        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">
                            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-x">
    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

        <div class="grid-x bg-white grid-padding-x grid-padding-y" style="width: 100%; position: relative;" itemtype="http://schema.org/Product" itemscope><div class="cell small-12" id="toptop"><h1 </div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-6"><likes-rating :perfume_id="14214" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></likes-rating></div><div class="cell small-6"><seasons-rating :perfume_id="14214" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></seasons-rating></div><div class="small-12 medium-6 text-center" style="max-height: 50px"><div itemprop="aggregateRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating" itemscope><p class="info-note">Perfume rating&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingValue">4.15</span>&nbsp;out of&nbsp;<span itemprop="bestRating">5</span> with&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingCount" content="2144">2,144</span> votes<meta itemprop="reviewCount" content="255"/></p></div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-12" itemprop="description" v-pre><p><b>Eau Rose</b> by <b>Diptyque</b> is a Floral Fruity fragrance for women. <b>Eau Rose</b> was launched in 2012. Top notes are Litchi, Black Currant and Bergamot; middle notes are Rose, Geranium and Jasmine; base notes are Musk, Virginia Cedar and White Honey. </p><p class="reviewstrigger" style="font-size: </fragram-photos-wrapper><div class="cell small-12"><div class="grid-x grid-padding-y" id="pyramid"><div class="cell"><div style="display: flex; flex-direction: column; justify-content: center; text-align: center; background: white;"><div class="strike-title"><span>Perfume Pyramid</span></div><pyramid-switch :perfume_id="14214"><pyramid-notes title="Main Notes According to Your Votes"></pyramid-notes><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Top Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="top"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.92711643842836; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.194.jpg" style="width: 3.475rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Litchi-194.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Litchi</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.8594681029756; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.132.jpg" style="width: 3.075rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Black-Currant-132.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Black Currant</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.82046435076082; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.75.jpg" style="width: 2.875rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Bergamot-75.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Bergamot</div></div></div>
</pyramid-level><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Middle Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="middle"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 1; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.105.jpg" style="width: 5rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Rose-105.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Rose</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.80477139066561; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.21.jpg" style="width: 2.8rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Geranium-21.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Geranium</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.73508893593265; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.14.jpg" style="width: 2.5rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Jasmine-14.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Jasmine</div></div></div>
</pyramid-level><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Base Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="base"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.85480333137226; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.4.jpg" style="width: 3.05rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Musk-4.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Musk</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.76557320030326; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.41.jpg" style="width: 2.625rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Cedar-41.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Virginia Cedar</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.75965265410792; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.181.jpg" style="width: 2.6rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Honey-181.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>White Honey</div></div></div>
</pyramid-level></pyramid-switch></div></div><div class="cell text-center"><button class="button small" data-open="NotesRatingModal">Vote for Ingredients</button></div></div><notes-rating :perfume_id="14214"></notes-rating></div><div class="cell small-12"><vue-encrypt-postscribe slotid='c7d69a289f3ee46edb11a51d99f1cbdf890' slotpayload='{"ct":"N\/XOWLRszDll2LOvLiJAs\/CL\/ew9VXqVFsPXLO8MLDqZa6Q7lgjwHkmt43sFa4kjsPaxwpIntQAwfAaClj+2wh7aV9DUkPu8E6Ter0GuDD0gskaI5UDxaxL1Oqz+XIe\/L8MeiKvP084dMZITRVB4jdLewF5YHTERxQK0NHOt2+1GYJ\/EWnHS1xffmh3wjUpMEq3lHh\/P8lrljJzHuW9G5onaxlovjtlS8BsdZFbxay3l9p2+MFsG08btMirB44Wm+dbv3jOZjlfe0FNUaV48j4yXMV9EPgsFk1WQcLIb1c4=","iv":"dbef1fca97e18bffb59e282e567e57a3","s":"5f59cc89087bc03d"}'></vue-encrypt-postscribe></div><div class="cell small-12"><div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-padding-y"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_3 -->

<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_5" v-pre>
</div></div><div class="cell small-12"><ul class="tabs" data-deep-link="true" data-update-history="true" data-deep-link-smudge="true" data-deep-link-smudge-delay="500" data-tabs id="deeplinked-tabs"><li class="tabs-title is-active"><a href="#all-reviews" aria-selected="true"><svg class="menu" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 20 20" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M10 18a8 8 0 100-16 8 8 0 000 16zm1-12a1 1 0 10-2 0v4a1 1 0 00.293.707l2.828 2.829a1 1 0 101.415-1.415L11 9.586V6z"clip-rule="evenodd"></path></svg>All reviews by date</a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#popular-positive-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><like style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;"></like><span class="show-for-medium">Positive Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#popular-negative-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><dislike style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;"></dislike><span class="show-for-medium">Negative Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#search-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><i class="fas fa-search"></i><span class="show-for-medium">Search</span></a></li></ul><reviews-wrapper><div class="tabs-content" data-tabs-content="deeplinked-tabs"><div class="tabs-panel is-active" id="all-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>All Reviews By Date</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
        <div class="cell destinationreview"></div>                    <div id="parent2357838" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2357838" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="karinatfragrantica"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1306511"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1306511.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="karinatfragrantica" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Jasmin-Kusamono-58909.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.58909.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jasmin Kusamono"title="Jasmin Kusamono"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2357838ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2357838" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1306511">karinatfragrantica</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-22">11/22/24 12:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>All I can think of when smelling it is pink rose. It is just that. A clean light rose, not overly sweet, not lemony, not honyed, not too soapy, just a light translucent rose. It is pretty and likeable but lacks character. But maybe that is not the intention for this type of scent. Sometimes "just pretty" is enough.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2357838"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2357838#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2356677" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2356677" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="elizabethdivine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1211040"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1211040.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="elizabethdivine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Akro/Glow-94352.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.94352.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Glow"title="Glow"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2356677ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2356677" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1211040">elizabethdivine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-21">11/21/24 11:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Upon first application, I get sweet, green freshness. There is an underlying musk, but it is light, and lasts for a while.  Next up- Geranium, or geraniol. Rose is ever present. its a friendly rose- not dusty, not quite jammy, but one thats bloomed in its prime with some watery element. The cedar base gives this otherwise light perfume some depth &amp; the honey lends sweetness, but doesnt stand out. I suddenly remember a beautiful peony body spray I had in high school, oh how nice! Body sprays were different back then lemme tell ya. This is ultimately an easy perfume to wear, inoffensive, perfectly feminine, and will most likely open you up if youre typically more closed off. This is a fun, lets go out! perfume. Youthful.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2356677"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2356677#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2349871" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2349871" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="subtlyyours"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1484865"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1484865.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="subtlyyours" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mix-Bar/Vanilla-Bourbon-66235.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66235.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla Bourbon"title="Vanilla Bourbon"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2349871ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2349871" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1484865">subtlyyours</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-15">11/15/24 08:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Pretty, light, inoffensive, easy reach for rose lovers. Its just crazy how ones definition of the scent of real roses can differ. To my nose, this is still very much still your typical perfumed rose reminiscent of rose water. Im still searching for a fragrance where if i close my eyes, Id be fooled into thinking my head was in rose bush. This missed that mark, but its still pleasant and worthy of a spot in a collection thats missing a simplistic rose fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2349871"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2349871#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2334482" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2334482" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ChloeG118"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1850006"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ChloeG118" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Dune-221.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.221.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dune"title="Dune"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2334482ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2334482" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1850006">ChloeG118</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-01">11/01/24 08:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I know this is a beloved rose scent, but it's a little blah for me. I love rose (though I tend not to like it as a perfume note because it doesn't smell like what I think rose should smell like, i.e., rose oil) and I want to love things from Diptyque other than Philosykos so badly because I love their aesthetic. Most of Diptyque's other offerings, however, I either viscerally dislike or are just blah, and Eau Rose falls into the second category.<br />
<br />
I'm not a big fruit/sweet fragrance person, so the lychee gave me real pause and the blackcurrant was a yellow flag, but thankfully neither are overpowering here. Noticeable if you know the notes are intended to be present, they just don't take over the overall fresh profile of this EDT. The most forward notes to my nose are rose (not the rose note I long for in perfume, but a nice enough watery rose), musk, and geranium. I only get a quick little snapshot of what others describe as smelling a fresh, dewy rose right after applying, though, and it evaporates like a mirage within minutes. As it dries down, I get more of the warmer, fuzzier notes like musk, and less of the floral and fruit.<br />
<br />
This becomes pretty boring pretty fast and has very little longevity. Within an hour, it's as though I was never wearing anything to begin with. I think in this price range, being boring and having no longevity make this a poor value to the dollar. 6/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2334482"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2334482#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2315781" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2315781" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="saebae"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2285977"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2285977.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="saebae" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/19-69/Female-Christ-62288.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62288.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Female Christ"title="Female Christ"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2315781ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2315781" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2285977">saebae</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-14">10/14/24 15:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have realized, I hate rose. This is so overwhelmingly rose for the first two hours but then dissipates into a curious floral-esque wood. If you're into rose, 100% go for it. To me this scent is just too linear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2315781"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2315781#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0; border: none; margin: 0;"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6" v-pre>
</div></div><div id="parent2314302" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2314302" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mary_pineapple"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1004131"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1004131.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mary_pineapple" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Philosykos-Eau-de-Parfum-3865.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3865.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Philosykos Eau de Parfum"title="Philosykos Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2314302ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2314302" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1004131">mary_pineapple</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-13">10/13/24 08:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Yes the first rose scent that is approaching photo realistic fresh rose to me! Every other rose I have tried immediately smells like Bulgarian rose oil. I am generally not a fan of florals because they smell more like the dried or chemical version me rather than the fresh deal. This is so well balanced, with the added freshness and sparkle from the citrus and sweetness from black currant. Its a beautiful green scent.<br />
<br />
Edit: partner is not impressed, says I smell like soap </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2314302"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2314302#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2312224" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2312224" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="iluvkitties"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2271282"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2271282.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="iluvkitties" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Glossier/You-Doux-97605.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.97605.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="You Doux"title="You Doux"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2312224ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2312224" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2271282">iluvkitties</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-11">10/11/24 09:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I mostly get lychee and jasmine in this after rose. Such a fresh and clean rose, but with a little green twist like many of Diptyque's other fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2312224"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2312224#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2311904" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2311904" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bambambi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1178725"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="bambambi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Versace/Eros-Pour-Femme-Eau-de-Toilette-39355.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39355.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eros Pour Femme Eau de Toilette"title="Eros Pour Femme Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2311904ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2311904" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1178725">bambambi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-11">10/11/24 02:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very well done green rose that I bought because it was green enough that the rose scent doesn't feel stuffy and at the time they were selling it as a limited edition. Wished that I took the time to test wear it because on my skin I'm mostly getting the roses and not the 'green' feeling of the rest of the perfume. I decided to rehome this to a friend after I have it just sitting in the back of the vanity for yrs and she reported that her mom loves it so much she sometimes sneaks into her room to apply it so I'm glad it's getting its uses with the right people XD</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2311904"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2311904#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2308528" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2308528" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="njcwu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1791897"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1791897.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="njcwu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Heretic-Parfum/Nosferatu-99008.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.99008.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nosferatu"title="Nosferatu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2308528ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2308528" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1791897">njcwu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-08">10/08/24 01:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>the most photorealistic pink rose scent ever</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2308528"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2308528#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2301742" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2301742" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mv88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193723"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1193723.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mv88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Glossier/You-46885.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46885.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="You"title="You"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2301742ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2301742" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193723">mv88</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-01">10/01/24 17:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The lychee and jasmin are the next prominent after the very green and rather aquatic rose.<br />
<br />
I'm never sure what I'm looking for in a rose scent <br />
I know I love the smell of fresh roses, but I'm never sure I have found exactly that in a perfume.<br />
Sometimes green roses are too much for me -- too much what? ...too sharply green and dewy, perhaps a touch too soapy or cloying?<br />
But then I like green scents, too...  <br />
<br />
Anyway, as far as green, bushy rose scents go, this one is a really good one and not overwhelmingly green for me.  It's modern, bright, fresh and lively, with none of a more traditional rose's dusty, powdery austerity (i like those, too, though).<br />
<br />
I love it *and* I'm unsure of it<br />
<br />
... and i think it's because I am the odd one out on how realistic I find it:<br />
other reviews overwhelmingly find it to be super realistic, but i just don't.  I think maybe what some people mean is that it doesn't smell like cheap chemical knockoff rose -- and that's totally true!<br />
<br />
But does it smell like the actual petals of the rose sitting in a vase in front of me?    I mean, no...<br />
And for years I helped maintain my grandma's giant yard packed with rosebushes, so i *kind of* think I know what that should smell like, but for me this scent is not "photorealistic."  It's really very pretty, though, and doesn't smell synthetic either.<br />
For me it's a lovely take on a dewy green rosebush, but I think I still haven't found "my" rose scent here.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2301742"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2301742#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2301059" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2301059" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ryder.co.uk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2208214"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2208214.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ryder.co.uk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2301059ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2301059" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2208214">ryder.co.uk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-01">10/01/24 05:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A bit like fig, rose accords in perfumery have become their own separate thing that bares little resemblance to the real thing. Much like strawberry flavoured drinks and snacks taste nothing like strawberries. This, however, is *exactly* like stuffing your nose inside a rose. She's a little dewy, a little ripe. She's frankly perfect. I didn't think I liked rose fragrances. Now I do.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2301059"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2301059#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2298422" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2298422" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nehad822"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2269841"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2269841.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nehad822" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2298422ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2298422" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2269841">nehad822</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-28">09/28/24 18:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A perfect fresh true rose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2298422"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2298422#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2288368" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2288368" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="charlotte__"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1354164"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1354164.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="charlotte__" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2288368ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2288368" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1354164">charlotte__</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-19">09/19/24 12:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ive never sampled a rose that smelled so much like a rose bush. It is undeniably green. The mellow roundness of damp soil and unassuming sharpness of green leaves. The rose is not cloying or powdery or sweet. Rather it is incredibly natural. You will smell like a garden of roses, not rose perfume. The jasmine adds a subtle sweetness. Overall surprisingly unisex and far more a green perfume than a pink one. Might even work well in winter because of this. Photorealistic to a rose garden. Recommend men try it actually.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2288368"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2288368#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2288267" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2288267" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Claugregg"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1439753"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1439753.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Claugregg" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Jazz-Club-20541.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.20541.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jazz Club"title="Jazz Club"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2288267ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2288267" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1439753">Claugregg</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-19">09/19/24 10:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The rose experienced in the way of Diptyque. Fresh, subtle, refreshing, slightly sweet. Not to be compared with a generic vintage rose perfume : this could please a younger crowd way more easily, with the rather fruity and sweet aspect of it. If you know someone that is not into roses, Eau Rose might change their opinion about this controversial, yet a timeless classic, flower.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2286066" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rosecakebaby"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2098232"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2098232.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rosecakebaby" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2286066ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2286066" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2267183" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="The Sarmouse"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2163373"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2163373.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="The Sarmouse" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2267183ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2267183" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.73); This is rose done right.<br />
<br />
To me its a soapy and fresh rose. Its smell a lot more youthful than the typical rose perfume. :-)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2267183"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2267183#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2267135" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2267135" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nella5*"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2166420"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nella5*" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Vilhelm-Parfumerie/Peony-Couture-60566.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60566.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Peony Couture"title="Peony Couture"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2267135ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2267135" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2166420">Nella5*</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-31">08/31/24 11:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A comforting, soft, woody, grown up, somewhat serious rose. You are in a library in an English country house with French doors that are open on to a rose garden.  It's early autumn, there's a light drizzle &amp; you've settled down with a scholarly book with a cup of fruit tea very slightly sweetened with a half teaspoon of honey which you will only discover at the bottom of the cup when you've finished it. Private, calming, thoughtful.  Sadly short lived.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2267135"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2267135#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2262566" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2262566" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="caruxcaru"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2136150"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="caruxcaru" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Franck-Boclet/Tobacco-29147.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29147.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tobacco"title="Tobacco"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2262566ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2262566" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); effervescent, really beautiful<br />
<br />
e: on second wear this perfume begins to smell more like a dewy rose. on a third wear, petals.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2254487"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2254487#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2250269" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2250269" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="acidgypsycat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1914210"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1914210.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="acidgypsycat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/L-Artisan-Parfumeur/Passage-d-Enfer-4572.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4572.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Passage d'Enfer"title="Passage d'Enfer"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2250269ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2250269" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1914210">acidgypsycat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-15">08/15/24 09:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lovely and simple scent. Very natural and realistic rose bush. Personally, I find it too linear and I would prefer it to have a little bit more depth, as there are many rose scents out there and unfortunately Eau Rose doesn't seem super unique. I appreciate that it feels fresh and not grandmotherly and I love wearing it when I am in the right mood. Good and elegant fragrance but basically just a realistic rose smell and nothing else which can be exactly what some people are looking for but a tiny bit boring for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2250269"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2250269#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2246186" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2246186" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="infiniteambrose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2219245"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2219245.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="infiniteambrose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lalique/Encre-Noire-1834.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1834.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Encre Noire"title="Encre Noire"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2246186ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2246186" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2219245">infiniteambrose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-11">08/11/24 17:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The jasmine overpowers the rose. Initially citrusy yet touch of sweet. And unlike Eau Capitale, which smells like a singular eternal rose, this smells like a newly watered, dewy rosebed. Beautiful all the same</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2246186"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2246186#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2246057" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2246057" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sleepy_cactus"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2212695"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sleepy_cactus" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marissa-Zappas/Flaming-Creature-71849.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71849.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Flaming Creature"title="Flaming Creature"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2246057ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2246057" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2212695">Sleepy_cactus</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-11">08/11/24 14:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a lovely realistic rose scent that also has a green quality to it. Its truly like freshly cut homegrown roses, which I suspect is due to the juicy lychee note. I find the majority of rose perfumes mature and powdery, which I absolutely cannot stand. This one is youthful, dewy, and not powdery at all. This is exactly what Im looking for in a rose perfume. Bonus points for reminding me of when I lived in Portland.<br />
<br />
Unfortunately it doesnt last long on skin, so I recommend buying the hair mist to keep it going for a bit longer. Because of its poor performance I think its a little overpriced. I do enjoy it a lot, but I dont think I will buy it again once Im done with my current bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2246057"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2246057#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2245482" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2245482" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amygoodall"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1788895"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1788895.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="amygoodall" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2245482ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2245482" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1788895">amygoodall</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-10">08/10/24 21:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>PERFECT rose. most of the time rose-centric perfumes feel way too youthful, too vintage, too green, too soapy, too sweet, etc. this avoids all of the worst stereotypes of rose perfumes. fresh and photorealistic in the best way possible, straightforward but not boring at all, because rose usually does Not pull like this. incredible, and I'm not even a rose fan.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2245482"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2245482#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2235507" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2235507" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fraghead97"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1826823"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1826823.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fraghead97" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2235507ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2235507" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1826823">fraghead97</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-01">08/01/24 04:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>take this review with a grain of salt because most people who try this love it and find it to very fresh. I find this to be less dewey and much more powdery - like sticking my face in expensive rose scented face powder or body care. there is something fruity / sparkling about it and the overall profile feels very youthful, but the powdery aspect on my skin keeps it from being a love. ive found my favorite truly dewey roses in water fresh scent to be delina la rosee.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2235507"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2235507#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2234454" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2234454" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eylulcnar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1681408"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1681408.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="eylulcnar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2234454ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2234454" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1681408">eylulcnar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-31">07/31/24 03:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Imagine yourself walking into a garden full of roses, and they have JUST been watered. This is exactly this experience bottled in. This is a fresh floral, but not in the way you might think. The freshness Diptyque has designed isn't a green freshness, yet a fruity one. It delivers a sweet lychee opening that is kind on the nose and isn't overpowering. On the contrary, the fruitiness works with the floral scent of the rose, allowing the a unique experience for a rose fragrance. A lot of rose fragrances usually smells like Turkish colognes (NOT derogatory) but this one does not have that alcoholic opening. I layer this perfume with a sweeter fruity perfume on winter and during summer I leave it as it is. <br />
<br />
This perfume has a special place in my heart as my aunties call me "my rose smelling lamb" (It sounds sweeter in my language I promise) and this was the first rose perfume my friend enjoyed and she despises rose perfumes. So it is best friend approved, ladies and gentlemen!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2234454"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2234454#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2233331" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2233331" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="spitfyre27"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/943062"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.943062.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="spitfyre27" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bath-Body-Works/Saltwater-Breeze-77527.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.77527.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Saltwater Breeze"title="Saltwater Breeze"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2233331ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2233331" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/943062">spitfyre27</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-29">07/29/24 22:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a sweet girlish rose.  Fresh, young, dewy, like rose water.  I like this so much.  I am usually put off by rose scents and just associate them with dense, old-fashioned perfumes that my grandma used to wear.  But this is just perfect for what it is, in my opinion.  Even if it sits close to the skin, there are some perfumes that aren't meant to be beast mode all the time.  Sometimes you just want a quiet scent that only you can smell.  My one quibble with this is it doesn't last that long, but I wouldn't mind respraying it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2233331"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2233331#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2226693" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
