padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2223578" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="emily385"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1833811"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="emily385" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2223578ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2223578" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1833811">emily385</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-19">07/19/24 14:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There's something about Diptque's formulations that always draw me in. I've been looking for a summer scent that's both juicy and fresh, and Eau Rose was the perfect match. I'm really picky about rose scents but the lychee note really develops this fragrance nicely. A lot of floral fragrances become too powdery or musky during the dry down, but Eau Rose stays juicy and fresh throughout.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2223578"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2223578#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2215116" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Extremely similar to  la rose MFK, and slightly like Delina. Absolutely amazing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2215116"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2215116#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2207922" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2201355" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Auratech"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2179076"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2179076.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Auratech" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2201355ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2201355" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2179076">Auratech</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-27">06/27/24 14:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really do love this fragrance for a hot ass day when that sun is just blasting down. It is EXTREMELY florally but in a good way. I loved unisex fragrances when I first got into collecting and this feels like a delicate homage to that time. The projection is low on this but if you happen to get a whiff of it on your shirt youll be greeted with soft florals and a little drop of sweetness. If you find it too florally I would reccomend the version above this one, that being the eau de parfum instead of the toilette.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2201355"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2201355#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2188400" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2188400" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tbirdfreebird"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1984900"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1984900.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tbirdfreebird" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Loewe/Loewe-Aura-White-Magnolia-60644.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60644.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Loewe Aura White Magnolia"title="Loewe Aura White Magnolia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2188400ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2188400" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1984900">tbirdfreebird</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-14">06/14/24 15:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So far my favorite rose/litchi scent. It's bright and lasts forever on my skin (was initially concerned because it was an EDT). I love how fresh and bright this scent is. I hope to keep this scent in my collection forever. I can imagine wearing it as Mom. So friendly and inviting but sophisticated. (better then Delina in my opinion)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2188400"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2188400#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2186014" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2186014" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Timofejeva"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1417683"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1417683.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Timofejeva" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Simone-Andreoli/Vicebomb-81910.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81910.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vicebomb"title="Vicebomb"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2186014ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2186014" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2186014"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2186014#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2172077" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2172077" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ajlis"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074474"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2074474.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ajlis" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/The-Noir-29-31872.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31872.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Noir 29"title="The Noir 29"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2172077ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2172077" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074474">Ajlis</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-30">05/30/24 00:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent is as fresh as the morning dewethereal, light, and realistic. Eau Rose is a rose perfume for those who thought they didn't like rose perfumes. To my nose, rose is often suffocating and overpowering in perfumes, but there is no danger of that in this fragrance. Eau Rose transports my mind to a summer evening, when I walk in a garden after the rain and smell the whole rose bushes: their delicate flowers, rain-damp leaves, and stems. By far the best rose scent I've ever tried. Simple but masterful.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2172077"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2172077#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2162043" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2162043" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="k8jo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1988705"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="k8jo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Ana-Abyedh-Poudree-84590.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84590.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ana Abyedh Poudre"title="Ana Abyedh Poudre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2162043ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2162043" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1988705">k8jo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-20">05/20/24 09:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My all-time favorite rose. Fresh, aquatic, a little sweet and a little soapy. Photorealistic rosewater. I agree it's undemanding, but sometimes that's what I want out of a rose fragrance. This also makes it surprisingly versatile: I have worn this to work, on a date, when running errands, and to bed. This is an easy reach and a good comfort scent. I wish it lasted longer, but can't have it both ways, i.e. comfy-fresh and a bomb.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2162043"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2162043#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2161007" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1236900">Lovetolove</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-03">05/03/24 11:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Rose at its most basic, with poor silage and an expensive price tag. Yes the bottle looks attractive and its considered to be a a niche brand do not be seduced by marketing. There are rose waters from India with more flattering concepts of a rose .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2144626"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2144626#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2140017" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2140017" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Noveight"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/259193"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.259193.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Noveight" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Alhambra/Berlinetta-84594.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84594.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Berlinetta"title="Berlinetta"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2140017ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2140017" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/259193">Noveight</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-29">04/29/24 09:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A watery, transparent rose scent. It has a nice tart quality to it that I enjoy. It is a very realistic and modern rose, it smells fresh and not at all cloying (like a powdery or soapy rose). Overall, an everyday spring and summer scent that makes me feel pretty. It doesn't last too long on my skin, but I can smell it all day on my clothes. I don't mind refreshing myself since the fragrance is so light it won't be overpowering by an accidental overspray. I didn't detect any lychee, but a better nose than mine may notice it. This is not a sweet perfume. It feels good to wear it in warmer weather.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2140017"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2140017#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2132874" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2132874" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cloudk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1983984"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1983984.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cloudk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2132874ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2132874" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1983984">cloudk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-22">04/22/24 13:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is very nice, lightly peppery. However, it doesn't exactly smell like a full rose scent. This smells like one of the notes within the rose, idk how else to explain it. It's a bit underdeveloped, but very nice. I don't think I would go for a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2132874"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2132874#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2123724" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2123724" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="omurie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2075628"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="omurie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Crivelli/Rose-SaltifOlia-53868.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53868.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose SaltifOlia"title="Rose SaltifOlia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2123724ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2123724" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2075628">omurie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-13">04/13/24 12:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i was going to blind buy this but thank godd i only bought a sample  i really like the notes and the first layer of it. it smells so watery and fresh like a rose being watered in the cool foggy morning. but oh god i hate the dry down so much, smells so mature and woody (as some people said it's a whole rose including the stem). not really a fan of woody note but god it's so headache inducing. it all comes down to personal preferences i think. i wanted to love it so much, i just couldn't handle the dry down and had to take a shower to take it off. maybe for someone else and not me<br />
also the performance is not the best, lasted on me for about 3 hours within a silage of an arm length.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2123724"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2123724#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2123086" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2117122" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="isha2003"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1837661"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1837661.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="isha2003" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2117122ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2117122" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1837661">isha2003</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-07">04/07/24 08:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>sweet rose, not artificial smelling. Smells like rose water, it lingers around for a moderate time, as every Diptyque perfume. Some may find this sickening, there is nothing as special about it for non-rose lovers. If you love watery rose scents though, I'd recommend you check this out. This rose screams youth to me, its pure scent, simple yet appreciable. Eau rose would be the neice of L'Ombre dans in my opinion. This is something you could wear all year round, very versatile.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2117122"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2117122#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2115922" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2115922" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="thaochipnd"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579302"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1579302.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="thaochipnd" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Olene-Eau-de-Toilette-3960.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3960.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Olene Eau de Toilette"title="Olene Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2115922ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2115922" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1579302">thaochipnd</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-06">04/06/24 01:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So beautiful! Fresh and romantic like a spring Rose garden around the meadow. The Rose is a bit sour but still perfectly beautiful, like the Dark Red Roses in the movie Beauty and the Beast. This is a great scent to start the day for Rose girls, it's a shame it doesn't last long. If Diptyque improved longevity, this would definitely be my favorite Rose scent. It's a pity that Eau Rose EDT doesn't last long, so I still prefer Eau Rose EDP.<br />
<br />
Rating: 8.5/10, not to be missed if you love Roses</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2115922"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2115922#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2114167" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Sadly I will not be buying this fragrance or anything from dyptique since you cant order small affordable samples or samplesets.  a basic service any company selling expensive fragrance should offer and I think we as a fragrance community should not be buying from companies that wont let us sample and expect everyone to spend 100 minimum for travelsizes</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Can't stop sniffing myself when I'm wearing it, but it does turn soapy after a while, which is unusual on my skin. Don't particularly mind, though. (For whatever it's worth, I wear the solid version of Eau Capitale because I'm frugal and like the portability, and I'm using a few collected sample vials of Eau Rose.)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; If youre a rose lover and do NOT enjoy the Delina line, this one is for you. This scent I find is very similar to Roses de Chloe. Very fresh, albeit not jammy  roses. Its not overpowering and could easily be someones daily daytime fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2109919"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2109919#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2109499" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2109499" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kitmarin08"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1846275"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kitmarin08" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2109499ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2109499" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1846275">Kitmarin08</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-31">03/31/24 00:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Signature scent worthy. I love rose. I have always loved roses. This one is a nice watery rose. The Diptyque website says there is ambroxan and I get that eatery freshness. The kind you get wafts of throughout the day. The honey note adds some much needed sweetness. This is perfect for layering and I love how it smells in my hair after a let it down. Some layering: Ombr dans LEau, AmorAmor, Nemat Vanilla Musk.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2109499"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2109499#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2105714" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2105714" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kari^ayam"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2034915"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kari^ayam" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Issey-Miyake/L-eau-d-Issey-720.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.720.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'eau d'Issey"title="L'eau d'Issey"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2105714ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2105714" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); I'm content to have sample vial for now.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2105714"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2105714#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2102661" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2102661" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cotton_crown"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1129010"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1129010.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cotton_crown" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Shalimar-Souffle-de-Parfum-26132.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.26132.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Shalimar Souffle de Parfum"title="Shalimar Souffle de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2102661ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2102661" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1129010">cotton_crown</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-24">03/24/24 09:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just can't decide on this one. Fresh, simple rose scent with next to no longevity or sillage on my skin. But it is lovely in its simple freshness, like a tall glass of water in dry heat. Maybe the solid version has more longevity?<br />
<br />
Edit - 6 hours later and it's as good as gone, a strange, almost plastic ghost of its former self. Breaks my heart.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2102661"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2102661#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2096754" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2096754" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="13yroldconnoisseur"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1692266"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1692266.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="13yroldconnoisseur" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2096754ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2096754" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1692266">13yroldconnoisseur</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-18">03/18/24 18:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Only real men wear rose fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2096754"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2096754#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2087149" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2087149" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="theroz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/361465"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.361465.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="theroz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Rose-31-3678.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3678.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose 31"title="Rose 31"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2087149ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2087149" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/361465">theroz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-09">03/09/24 09:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>After trying about 30 perfumes (designer, and some niche) to layer my signature scent with (Le Labo - Rose 31), I finally found a rose centric perfume that brings out the beautiful complexity of Rose 31 to a less spicy place. <br />
<br />
The first 20 minutes are a bit sharp for me, just like any other perfume, but then it dries down to a realistic fresh clean but soft rose. <br />
Eau Rose feels fresh but not aquatic nor sharp, it feels clean like rose water indeed, there's a touch of cedar and musk that makes it almost powdery and somewhat dry, and a touch of honey (which I absolutely did not want as I hate gourmands) that rounds it all up very elegantly. It never gets jammy, juicy, nor sweet to me.<br />
<br />
For reference, I have a thing for clean "dry" scents, Escentric molecules, Gypsy Water, Infusion d'Iris, Glossier You, were favorites at some time or another. <br />
I went the EDT route to make sure it wouldn't overshadow Rose 31, it's perfect for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2087149"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2087149#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2086407" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2086407" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="transcendscent"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1227293"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="transcendscent" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2086407ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2086407" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1227293">transcendscent</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-08">03/08/24 13:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh cut, green roses. Not your grandma's rose perfume. Smells modern yet classic. Unfortunately, this doesn't last long on my bare skin. After 30 minutes, it doesn't project at all. Diptyque's L'Ombre Dans Leau has a similar fresh rose note, yet is stronger, lasts much longer, and projects more. It's also harsher. Eau Rose is very nice - 7/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2086407"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2086407#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2068251" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2068251" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cokette"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1334767"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1334767.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cokette" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2068251ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2068251" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1334767">cokette</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-20">02/20/24 09:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An inherently beautiful rose scent, among the best for me. <br />
I am not typically a floral fan, but I couldn't help but fall in love with this rose.<br />
<br />
Reminds me of embracing your mother, who smells of rose water and honey. Very much an intimate scent, sitting close to the skin. Perfect if you are looking for fresh daytime realism, not so much a power projector.<br />
Not so long lasting, but works for me in an ephemeral sense, like being momentarily caught in a spring breeze as you walk by a rose bush.<br />
<br />
And as always with Diptyque, beautiful and thoughtful bottle design.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2068251"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2068251#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2064159" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2064159" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kpop_stan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1543675"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1543675.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kpop_stan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2064159ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2064159" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1543675">kpop_stan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-16">02/16/24 09:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Edit: welp... thank GOD I passed by a tester for Yardley's English Rose today, because it's literally indistinguishable from this. For a tenth of the price. I was gearing up to buy this within the next couple of weeks too... whew!!! Money saved <br />
-<br />
Have I done it? After years of searching, have I finally found my perfect rose water perfume?!<br />
<br />
Well, yes and no. When I sprayed this on I could've WEPT. I've wanted "the perfect" rose water perfume for YEARS, long before I even picked this up as a hobby! Everything I've tried is too rose-forward (what I want needs to be 50:50 aquatic/watery &amp; rose), or too much extra clouding the composition (greenery, citrus, jasmine, etc...). Seeing the scent pyramid for this one had my hopes in the gutter, yet here I am! ... Well, the drawback, you may ask? That beautiful, fresh, aquatic, delicate rose opening all too soon (about 2 hours) gives way to the woody musk base notes, and it gets up my nose in the same disagreeable way most men's perfumes do. It's such a shame! <br />
<br />
Also, this and MFK L'eau A La Rose are surprisingly similar, except that one is more "perfume-y" and this feels more mellow, and dare I say realistic. <br />
<br />
This is a 9/10 for me; I have a handful more to test but if they're all a bust, I'm calling it a day and buying this one. ETA: yep, crowning this one as my winner!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2064159"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2064159#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2051213" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2051213" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="robertambark"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1434211"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1434211.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="robertambark" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Wood-Sage-Sea-Salt-25529.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25529.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wood Sage & Sea Salt"title="Wood Sage & Sea Salt"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2051213ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2051213" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1434211">robertambark</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-03">02/03/24 13:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very simple and realistic rose water scent. The simplicity compliments your skin and makes it very versatile overall: daytime date, work, running errands.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2051213"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2051213#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2039286" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2039286" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="janeway"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1943625"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1943625.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="janeway" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2039286ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2039286" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1943625">janeway</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-23">01/23/24 04:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells like you cut a single rose from the bush and minced it on a cutting board, petals and stem and leaves all mashed together. Super realistic, light and watery. I love simple rose so this was love at first sniff. I'll get the FB the moment I spend my decant, it's that good.<br />
<br />
(It does, however, smell like rose air refreshener with extra steps, so be careful if you don't like such realistic scents.)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2039286"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2039286#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2031590" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Rose and lychee is a classic combo, and Diptyque beautifully mastered the duo. May be too strong and cause headaches for some, however. My personal favorite Diptyque scent. Won't buy again due to animal testing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2031590"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2031590#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2021648" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2021648" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cogey"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1947978"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1947978.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cogey" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2021648ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2021648" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); Super fresh roses with the leaves and stem, dew, I get that slight honey note in the background. The geranium adds a lot of freshness. Im transported to walking along a quiet road on a morning just after its rained, coming upon a rose garden and sticking my nose right inside of one. Fresh, green, sweet, very real rose. Definitely buying a full bottle of this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="2021648"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=2021648#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2015214" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1993432" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ghoulish"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1828456"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ghoulish" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1993432ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1993432" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);
