align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1993432"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1993432#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1986587" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1986587" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aska2in"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1900525"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1900525.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="aska2in" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Luna-38351.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38351.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Luna"title="Luna"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1986587ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1986587" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1900525">aska2in</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-27">11/27/23 11:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As someone who dislikes anything too floral, this is the perfect rose for me. Eau Rose smells like walking through a rose garden after the rain, nothing more, nothing less. I love how refreshing, simple and undemanding this fragrance is, and Im glad I dont get much of the fruitiness. My only complaint and the only thing stopping me from breaking the bank and buying a full size is the longevity. Im either nose blind or this perfume dissapears after two-three hours, which is such a shame. Like most of diptyques fragrances, this one wears pretty close to skin and has that mysterious quality. Great for the office, simple outfits and staying home.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1986587"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1986587#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1981313" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1981313" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tao_tao"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1665115"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tao_tao" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Miss-Dior-Blooming-Bouquet-2023-78945.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78945.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Miss Dior Blooming Bouquet (2023)"title="Miss Dior Blooming Bouquet (2023)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1981313ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1981313" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1665115">Tao_tao</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-20">11/20/23 16:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Great!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1981313"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1981313#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1972212" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1972212" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vanillamuscdream"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1721706"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1721706.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vanillamuscdream" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Fleur-de-Peau-Eau-de-Parfum-48681.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48681.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fleur de Peau Eau de Parfum"title="Fleur de Peau Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1972212ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1972212" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1721706">Vanillamuscdream</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-08">11/08/23 23:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is an absolutely gorgeous fragrance. Ive been interested in rose ever since I first tried Bvlgaris Rose Goldea which smells very clean and fresh. I think I may actually prefer Eau rose. I see a lot of reviews saying that its quite boring and smells just like rose water, but its a lot more complex than it first seems. At least, for me, anyway. The fruity and tropical notes combined with the rose make it intoxicatingly delicious. It makes me feel really feminine and soft. I usually go for EDP but was giving an EDT sample. I hope to try the EDP too.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1972212"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1972212#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1957357" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1957357" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HopeEliza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1854653"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1854653.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HopeEliza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Delina-43871.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43871.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Delina"title="Delina"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1957357ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1957357" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1854653">HopeEliza</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-21">10/21/23 05:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Right out of the bottle I didn't like this as it was so potent as to be off-putting, but it did dry down to a pleasant albeit linear rose-water scent. I was interested in this scent because it had a very similar note pyramid to other fragrances which are favourites of mine, but unfortunately in Eau Rose, anything other than the rose note is pure fantasy. I do enjoy the scent and I will use up my decant, however I would personally be loathe to shell out for a full bottle at retail price, when the same effect could be achieved by simply dabbing a bit of rose water on one's skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1957357"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1957357#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1934748" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1934748" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mariforeverr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1773695"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="mariforeverr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1934748ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1934748" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1773695">mariforeverr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-22">09/22/23 12:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>the opening is a gorgeous fruity rose that I could sniff for hours, except that I can't because the performance on this is terrible. The first 10-15 minutes of this is my favorite rose I've ever smelled but it's just too clean to stick to me I guess. might opt for the hair mist to use as a linen spray</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1934748"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1934748#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1932747" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1932747" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jlaurw"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1843740"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="jlaurw" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1932747ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1932747" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1843740">jlaurw</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-20">09/20/23 09:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Full disclosure, I love florals but I am very picky about florals. Synthetic smelling florals make me sick and give me a headache. When I was younger, I wore Chloe EDP as my daily scent and while not as synthetic as other rose scents I've tried it still gave me a headache. Now I absolutely adore the smell of roses. My grandmother, mother, and now myself were and are avid rose gardeners. The fresh scent of real roses floods me with joyful memories and I've yet to find a perfum that elicits those memories. Eau Rose is the closest I've gotten to capturing that scent memory. While the notes are somewhat similar to Chloe, the cedar note feels more present and the bergamot and black currant add a citrus / fruity note that leans aquatic on me. The result of that is on the nose this scent very much smells like a rose bush on a cooler day in Autumn after a fresh layer of mulch has been laid to prepare for winter. The rose is a natural rose and the bergamot and blackcurrant add a dewy, cool element while the cedar gives it a mulchy layer. All of these elements lend a sense of realism to the rose smell that is lacking in most rose scents I've tried. On dry down this softens into a lovely soft rose that loses the aquatic element but retains the mulch element from the cedar. So while it remains floral it never becomes one note but instead fades into a well rounded scent reminiscent of the last bush bloom before winter. It's a rose on a cold day sitting in mulch. Projection on first spray is moderate and after in hour projection is intimate but again Dipthyque has great longevity on my skin. I put this on before bed (very relaxing) and woke up 7 hrs later still very clearly able to smell this on myself. This scent is a very nice realistic take on the rose bush as a whole.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1932747"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1932747#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1919510" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1919510" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kayqin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/228322"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="kayqin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14214.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Rose"title="Eau Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1919510ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1919510" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/228322">kayqin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-04">09/04/23 10:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I think I got my tiny tester vial for free at one of the London stores. Unlike my other Diptyque testers,  think I'll actually use this one up - I'm not a big floral person but this is just pure, simple rose. Its performance is great, not too much, not too little. It has one job and it does it really well.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1919510"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1919510#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1915177" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1915177" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kpeachy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1826496"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1826496.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kpeachy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1915177ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1915177" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1826496">Kpeachy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-30">08/30/23 06:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love Eau Rose - when I spray, it paints a picture of beautiful pink rose with morning few or rain drop on it. Its pure and pretty.<br />
I feel positive on the days I wear it. <br />
<br />
I love the purity of rose here. Its my perfect true rose scent. Its not feminine or perfumery <br />
I tried rose fragrances by Byredo, Le labo, Jo malone, Dior, Chanel they smell gorgeous and more complex but never come close to being true rose like Eau Rose.<br />
<br />
I could see myself wearing Eau Rose day time and Eau Capital for evenings.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1915177"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1915177#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1912745" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1912745" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="washudtoj"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1327091"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1327091.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="washudtoj" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/The-Body-Shop/Full-Ylang-Ylang-82679.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.82679.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Full Ylang Ylang"title="Full Ylang Ylang"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1912745ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1912745" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1327091">washudtoj</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-27">08/27/23 09:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fell flat on me somehow, despite the fact that I love rose scents typically.<br />
<br />
It's rose, but it's just that. Rose water. No other complexity. For the price, I expect much more, and no, I didn't smell much of any other notes in the perfume pyramid.<br />
<br />
Would you pay $$$$$ for a bottle of rose water? I don't know about you but I wouldn't.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1912745"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1912745#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1908865" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1908865" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NiWi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1813451"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1813451.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="NiWi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Fenty/Fenty-68677.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68677.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fenty"title="Fenty"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1908865ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1908865" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1813451">NiWi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-22">08/22/23 15:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Finally a realistic, dewy rose that smells beautiful throughout, unlike Jo Malone red roses that turns into a horrible sour dry down on my skin (almost like urine). Eau Rose is on my wishlist</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1908865"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1908865#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1906968" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1906968" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="anniekins"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1730842"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1730842.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="anniekins" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1906968ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1906968" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1730842">anniekins</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-20">08/20/23 10:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I feel like I've smelled this perfume a long time ago since rosewater is a very common scent that is found in many perfumes in the past. It's a typical classic rose scented perfume. The scent of the rose is very strong, but the overall perfume projection is intimate, and not a lot of people will know you are wearing this perfume - but your partner will do.<br />
<br />
Vibe: My grandma regularly wore another rose perfume back in the early 2000s and she is a classy woman so this reminds me a lot of her and the vibes I am getting is a classy older woman who wears pearl jewelry. You can never go wrong with this classic rose perfume. Perfect to wear during early spring. <br />
<br />
This perfume also smells very close to the Rose Water &amp; Ivy lotion by Bath and Body works so I layer this Diptyque perfume with that. If this perfume is out of your budget, just buy the Bath and Body works one. It really smells very similar to it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1906968"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1906968#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1904802" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Sadly it doesnt last on me well and projection is quite intimate too.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1904802"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1904802#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1902699" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1902699" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cyclone1391"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/666114"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.666114.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cyclone1391" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1902699ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1902699" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/666114">cyclone1391</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-15">08/15/23 07:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The only notes I get on my skin are Bergamont, rose, and honeycomb. Almost an exact copy of Jo Malone red roses. Edp vs edt, edp has an almost peppery quality to the opening that is fleeting, then they're identical. I do prefer these bottles to the Jo Malone bottle but jo Malone has slightly better performance. That being said, I would sooner purchase Rose from BBW.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1902699"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1902699#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1901365" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1893740" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cgaleb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1753541"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1753541.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cgaleb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dries-Van-Noten/Jardin-de-L-Orangerie-72594.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72594.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jardin de L'Orangerie"title="Jardin de L'Orangerie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1893740ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1893740" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1753541">cgaleb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-03">08/03/23 21:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the loveliest rose perfume Ive yet to experience. It is so realistic, the sweetness of the petals, the bit of greenness of the stem. Just beautifully done.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1893740"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1893740#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1893628" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1893628" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mrebjam"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1807127"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="mrebjam" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Merit/Retrospect-98154.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.98154.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Retrospect"title="Retrospect"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1893628ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1893628" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1807127">mrebjam</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-03">08/03/23 17:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The freshest, cleanest rose perfume I've found to this date. I think it's easy for rose scents to be overly spicy or musky, and while there is a time and a place for sexier rose scents, I love the purity of this one. I'll probably buy the hair mist at the very least.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1893628"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1893628#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1888562" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1888562" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alice_w"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1795150"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1795150.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alice_w" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1888562ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1888562" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); It smells like a rose garden after rain - fresh, clean, sweet and dewy. It has become one of my sleep scents.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1888562"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1888562#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1881460" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This is the kind of rose parfum that I love and can be easily wear anywhere. Most of rose parfum that I have is quite heavy and powdery and I prefer to use it at night time (example Narcisso for her and Kenzo L'absolute).... Try to find rose parfume that are more fresh and easy to wear is hard, I find most of rose parfume sometimes smells just like a rose tonic water... But Diptyque Eau rose is different, I can smell the rose water but more elegant, this fragrance makes me fell beautiful. Will repurchase it</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1874723"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1874723#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1873821" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Lichi disappear very soon on paper, yet on skin last for hours. Trust "Lichi" note comes from "Geranium Bourbon". Very adorable smell for ladies/unisex in spring/summer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1873821"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1873821#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1866238" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1866238" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PNBP"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/183608"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.183608.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PNBP" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Paris-Deauville-49697.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49697.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Paris  Deauville"title="Paris  Deauville"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1866238ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1866238" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/183608">PNBP</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-27">06/27/23 23:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Have always been in the search of a fresh rose scent and failed every time as the suggested scents turn out pretty powdery and unpleasant to my nose in tropical country like Vietnam (yuck). I want fresh, crispy, dewy roses from the garden after the rain, or roses that covered in dews in the early morning, the kinda of rose that takes me straight to a garden of even more roses. I was skeptical with this option first and as soon as Diptyque was launched in Vietnam, I had to hop out to figure myself. And I wasn't disappointed! It is EXACTLY the kinda of rose juice I spent years looking for. Have to grab it this year's birthday as a reward after much hassles!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1866238"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1866238#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1864489" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1864489" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="edward1119"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1753188"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1753188.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="edward1119" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nicolai-Parfumeur-Createur/Amber-Oud-22192.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.22192.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Amber Oud"title="Amber Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1864489ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1864489" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1753188">edward1119</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-25">06/25/23 18:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Interesting linchi+rose top note. Lichi disappear very soon on paper, yet on skin performance is much better. Trust "Lichi" note comes from "Geranium Bourbon". Very adorable smell in spring/summer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1864489"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1864489#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1862550" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1862550" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cosmicbrownie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1436867"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="cosmicbrownie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1862550ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1862550" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1436867">cosmicbrownie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-22">06/22/23 21:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I first smelled this in February of 2022 at a Diptyque counter and I could not stop thinking about it. I bought the hair mist to test it couple months later (and also received a sample of the EDT and EDP in that order) and it only further cemented my love for this scent. I bought a full bottle of the EDT about a year ago and I can only say my love for this fragrance has only grown.<br />
<br />
There is something so youthful about this fragrance that I have yet to smell in any other rose perfumes; so many of which have a mature or vintage vibe to them. It checks off all the boxes for me. Sweet but not cloying at all, fun and elegant at the same time, and fresh and clean but still warm. I wear it to work, to bed, to weddings, on vacation, really anywhere. I had to force myself to not wear it in the cooler months, and nothing I wore during that time garnered the same amount of compliments as this one does. Diptyque's prices will always be my only gripe but for something that brings me so much joy it's worth it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1862550"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1862550#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1849580" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1849580" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dhits77"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1762907"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1762907.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dhits77" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chloe/Ylang-Cananga-69291.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69291.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ylang Cananga"title="Ylang Cananga"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1849580ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1849580" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1762907">Dhits77</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-05">06/05/23 09:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a fresh rose scent with a lovely musky dry down. The litchy and blackcurrant burst ensures an olfactory grand entrance that quickly gives way to the main act: the rose in fact, the rose was so dominant it gave me a slight headache. Good thing the scent smells authentic. <br />
<br />
After a while the rose fades and reveals the musk and woody notes underneath and the fragrance settles into a skin scent. It is pleasant and is safe for work. Perhaps too safe even - the scent becomes uninteresting after a short while. There are many fragrances like this as rose is back in fashion anyway. I had a difficult time telling this one apart.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1849580"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1849580#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1849348" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1849348" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PlanetGrl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1105018"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1105018.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PlanetGrl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Coffee-Break-55926.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55926.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coffee Break"title="Coffee Break"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1849348ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1849348" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1105018">PlanetGrl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-05">06/05/23 02:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Like a freshly watered rose bush. As much as I like this, Diptyque should be ashamed of the price.  Clean, linear, and un-unique, this works for the office and in warm weather. The rose is so strong I personally cant pick up much of anything else, a little of the bergamot up top and the powderiness of the geranium, then a clean smelling musk peeks out as it dries. To be clear, this is utterly, overwhelmingly rose. If thats what you want Id advise getting a mini or sample of this first due to its price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1849348"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1849348#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1808120" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1808120" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Misia Cloudy Lamb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1567465"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1567465.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Misia Cloudy Lamb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1808120ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1808120" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1567465">Misia Cloudy Lamb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-13">04/13/23 16:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I should love it because of the notes.. rose, litchi, blackcurrant, geranium I dont get it at all. The only one condition under I would agree that this is similar to Delina is if we would talk about Delina that went bad. It reminds me a little bit of Mogu Mogu Litchi though.<br />
<br />
Super discordant composition.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1808120"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1808120#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1797798" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1797798" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LizDee007"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1498688"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1498688.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LizDee007" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Under-The-Lemon-Tree-53379.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53379.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Under The Lemon Tree"title="Under The Lemon Tree"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1797798ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1797798" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1498688">LizDee007</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-01">04/01/23 05:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Similar to Parfum de Marley Delina..almost but not as juicy and full bodied. Eau Rose is a spicy fresh rose that reminds me of beautiful Delina. Imagine a rose with a green spiciness to it..just refreshing and clean scent. Performance is average (2-3 hours) then becomes a close skin scent but I dont mind because that spicy note is still prevalent. <br />
<br />
If I want to make this last even longer, I just layer with Delina body crme  Will repurchase</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1797798"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1797798#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1793982" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1793982" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jemly"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1007738"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1007738.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jemly" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Oriza-L-Legrand/Relique-D-Amour-16255.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16255.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Relique D'Amour"title="Relique D'Amour"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1793982ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1793982" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1007738">jemly</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-27">03/27/23 12:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>while i appreciate the idea of it, i'm not usually a fan of litchi/lychee. too sweet, too fruity, in particular when working in conjunction with something like black currant. makes my teeth hurt just thinking of it. there's something about diptyque's rose note, however, that makes eau rose a huge exception to my general rule. greener, perhaps due to the geranium, than other famous rose/lychee forward fragrances such as PDM delina (with delina's vanilla and cashmere enhancing that sweetness rather than balancing it out). i love to find exceptions to my rules !<br />
<br />
there are countless other "basic" rose scents out there, sure. but diptyque set out to make a singular, fresh, dewy spring rose, and they achieved it. it's *pretty*. sometimes that's all we want. to smell of the rose outside of an imagined bedroom window.<br />
<br />
lately, i've been rather drawn to more nuanced, ostensibly simpler perfumes. they're there to enhance your essence, your personality, your personal style, rather than define it. the type of fragrances that used to bore me now fill my imagination up the most!<br />
<br />
what's more, though....a man wearing this would flip all that whimsical pretty preciousness on its head. unexpected and therefore deeply alluring, it would send me spinning if i smelled this on a guy. i love a man in flowers.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1793982"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1793982#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1792445" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1792445" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="centifoliaqueen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1683285"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1683285.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="centifoliaqueen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6458.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bal d'Afrique"title="Bal d'Afrique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1792445ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1792445" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1683285">centifoliaqueen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-25">03/25/23 12:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a bright, fresh, watery, soapy rose. I personally prefer the EDP version of Eau Rose but can appreciate them both. Very different perfumes.<br />
<br />
And: I have great news for Diptyque Eau Rose *EDT* lovers. Just found a dupe that's spot on: Solinotes Paris' Rose EDP. $20 for 1.7oz and highly recommend. The only difference is it's a little more subtle, but still has acceptable sillage (&amp; can't beat the price).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1792445"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1792445#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1778637" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1778637" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="shoujomarina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1440667"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1440667.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="shoujomarina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maya-Njie/Tobak-63296.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.63296.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tobak"title="Tobak"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1778637ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1778637" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);
