Smells lovely, literally like rose water. Inoffensive, cant wait to wear it in summer!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1770367"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1770367#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1768818" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1768818" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zahraa555"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1240748"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1240748.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zahraa555" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Shalimar-Souffle-de-Parfum-26132.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.26132.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Shalimar Souffle de Parfum"title="Shalimar Souffle de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1768818ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1768818" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1240748">Zahraa555</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-25">02/25/23 03:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a very simple perfume if you like the smell of bottled rose water. Plain rose water with some juicy sweet lychee. More on the natural side and does not smell synthetic/strong at all. Easy to wear, but nothing extraordinary. I dont get any bergamot or woods in here. <br />
Lasting power and projection is weak.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1768818"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1768818#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1767374" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1767374" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eaterofhummus"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1683211"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="eaterofhummus" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1767374ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1767374" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1683211">eaterofhummus</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-23">02/23/23 10:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like this smell. I'm a guy, but I think it smells great on me. It's a really nice fruity floral scent. I mostly got it because I really wanted something with a strong lychee note, and this absolutely delivers on that front. It makes me happy to smell it.I think it works great as a daily scent during warmer weather. It does not last very long though and the scent stays rather close to the skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1767374"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1767374#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1766982" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1766982" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nanaa_from_ghana"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1509671"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="nanaa_from_ghana" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1766982ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1766982" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1509671">nanaa_from_ghana</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-22">02/22/23 22:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a really beautiful rose perfume. Unfortunately, its not very original. To my nose and on my skin, this smells very similar to Carolina Herrera Very Good Girl, except weaker. I get the same rose-litchi-currant as I get with VGG, only this one is muskier in the dry down and not as sweet. The rose is also more prominent in Eau Rose compared to VGG, which leans more fruity. <br />
<br />
I think VGG, Delina, and Angel Nova all run in the same scent group, and I think you can add this one to it as well. Its beautiful, but redundant. Im giving my 3.4 oz to my mom for her birthday as I already have VGG and love that one. I havent tested the longevity and projection on this, but Im sure its good because most of Diptyques frags are good on the performance (besides Eau Duelle EDT ). <br />
<br />
I like the EDP flanker of Eau Rose more than this one because its more interesting with the notes of chamomile and artichoke. However, I still think this is nice to have if youre looking for a nice, uncomplicated rose thats not super strong and in your face. Itll be a beautiful scent for the spring.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1766982"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1766982#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1760826" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Considering a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1760826"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1760826#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1750397" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1750397" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Shui-Xian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1541621"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1541621.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Shui-Xian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Versatile-Paris/Accrodisiaque-78636.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78636.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Accrodisiaque"title="Accrodisiaque"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1750397ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1750397" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1541621">Shui-Xian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-02">02/02/23 23:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This rose is divine and fabulous in every note (which are developing very originally here)...<br />
<br />
I absolutely love the opening: it is not just fresh, dewy rose. The fruit aroma of litchi makes it jummy and juicy. <br />
<br />
Spicy and warm note rises also. Cedar is quite appealing and becomes even stronger. <br />
I don't smell jasmine and geranium much:  rose is the queen. <br />
<br />
The perfume stays on skin in woody scent. Thanks to musk there is a hint of animality, but only in sensual, seductive way. Still it is an graceful, sophisticated scent with lively charm. <br />
<br />
Although it could be simple rose, this perfume offers an original view of it. I appriciate the photoreality and artistic quality, it is amazing...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1750397"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1750397#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1738297" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1738297" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cloudswirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1396591"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1396591.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cloudswirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kayali-Fragrances/The-Wedding-Velvet-Santal-35-83207.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83207.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Wedding Velvet Santal | 35"title="The Wedding Velvet Santal | 35"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1738297ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1738297" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1396591">cloudswirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-19">01/19/23 14:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really enjoy this rose fragrance, and I'm not a super rose lover. I was absolutely blown away when I sampled this in store, and definitely am going to try to get a FB when I can. <br />
<br />
This does not smell like rose water to me at all, at least the rose water I have.  This fragrance to me comes off as an actual fresh rose fragrance. I wouldn't even dare to call it jammy, because it's definitely like you plucked a rose off the stem and smelled it. <br />
<br />
I've had many rose experiences from mixed rose attars, to dealing with rose water and I do honestly think this is one of THE BEST rose fragrances I've ever smelled.<br />
<br />
Update: I decided to go for a small sample to wear outside the store as well, and this has almost no lasting power on me. ;-; my skin just eats it up! So disappointing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1738297"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1738297#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1735056" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1735056" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="WhiteFlowerPrincess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1662712.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="WhiteFlowerPrincess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Lucky-48385.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48385.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lucky"title="Lucky"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1735056ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1735056" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712">WhiteFlowerPrincess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-15">01/15/23 19:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I first tried this in Mecca about a week ago after sampling  La Rose by Maison Francis Kurkdijan for the uptempth time and still not being sure about it ( La Rose, that is.)<br />
<br />
I told the girls in Mecca that I was desperate to find a realistic smelling rose that was a sweet pink rose with no citrus and little to no woodiness in the base, since I hate anything that is strong or smells remotely masculine.<br />
<br />
Well, they were right... this smells just like pure rosewater distilled from the rose! It delighted me so much, since the queen of flowers reigns supreme in this perfume and none of the other notes take over. All I can smell other than that is a tiny bit of litchi at the top to make it smell not as simple and a bit more sweet, but that's it. I also smell a tiny bit of the musk here, but I don't mind musk at all.<br />
<br />
If you want a lovely and feminine smelling rose that smells like the floral and not disgusting potpourri, citrus or some woody masculine scent that would smell better on your boyfriend or husband, buy this! My search for the perfect rose scent is finally complete :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1735056"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1735056#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1730128" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1730128" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="shannfernando"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1072211"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1072211.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="shannfernando" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/L-Occitane-en-Provence/Eau-des-Baux-2034.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2034.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau des Baux"title="Eau des Baux"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1730128ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1730128" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1072211">shannfernando</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-10">01/10/23 05:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Meh its okay. Smells like Chloe!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1730128"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1730128#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1728390" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1728390" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="saekki"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1451175"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1451175.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="saekki" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1728390ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1728390" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1451175">saekki</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-08">01/08/23 03:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i've never had a fragrance follow its olfactory pyramid so accurately before - i got a quick burst of sweet lychee followed by jammy rose followed by something soapy (which i'm assuming was the combination of musk and white honey). <br />
<br />
surprisingly artificial given its tagline ("the whole rose, stem and all") and diptyque's reputation as a house, but not unpleasant. i don't know. i'm not a rose girl</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1728390"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1728390#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1728290" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1728290" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="camnymymo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1601044"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1601044.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="camnymymo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1728290ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1728290" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1601044">camnymymo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-08">01/08/23 01:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A youthful, flirty rose that will make you smile with each sniff! My first ever Diptyque purchase, this was my gateway; very safe blind buy for women who love a daily rose scent. <br />
<br />
I love to use this for layering, my personal favorite mix is LOmbre Dens LEau EDP with Eau Rose. It give some sweetness and enhances the rose, blending beautifully with the black current leaf. Highly recommend!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1728290"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1728290#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1706197" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1692896" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lihsinhsu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1273388"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="lihsinhsu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1692896ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1692896" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1273388">lihsinhsu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-21">11/21/22 01:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very nice rose. Some roses are too powdery or too green. This one's young and fresh without being overpowering. It starts out more fruity, lychee, then it gets softer after that, becoming more soapy and bubble bath. It's a little one-dimensional, but nevertheless it is very pleasant and non-offending. A good day time or work perfume for sure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1692896"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1692896#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1679172" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1371398">teh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-02">11/02/22 05:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I remember smelling this many years ago and thinking to myself wow this smells so realistic, just like a real rose. Today I stumbled upon Eau Rose (EDT) again and I had a completely different impression. I got a full blast of sweet lychee and some abstract floral notes that smell like chamomile, but not rose at all. Things appear to be really detached and synthetic to my nose. Not sure if they reformulated it in the past years or my nose has actually changed as I grew older? Either way I dont think its a great blend especially in comparison with other amazing creations in the Diptyque lineup</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1679172"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1679172#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1677269" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It does have this interesting after sniff, that reminds me of salt and vinegar chips (which I love). But it isnt as fresh or sweet as my beloved Roses de Chloe. An easy wear and layerable scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1677269"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1677269#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1676891" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This is an easy-to-wear perfume. I suppose no one would hate it if you wear it in work.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1676891"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1676891#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1675612" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1675612" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cvdwatson"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1334272"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1334272.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cvdwatson" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1675612ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1675612" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1334272">Cvdwatson</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-27">10/27/22 14:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first sniff, I was really concerned that I just wasted 1/5 of my discovery set on this?? SO MUCH ROSE. Oh no.<br />
<br />
Never fear, int he dry down it chills out with a smidgen of sweetness (lychee and black currant add balance). So many old fragrances mix rose with patchouli (yuck). Thankfully this has no patchouli to make my nose wrinkle.<br />
<br />
I'm pleased to report this as a slightly more modern, balanced, rose SKIN scent than my initial impression.<br />
<br />
I will happily use my 10ml...But I have no plans to purchase a full size.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1675612"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1675612#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1674728" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1674728" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/455961"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.455961.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/L-Eau-d-Hiver-2797.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2797.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Eau d'Hiver"title="L'Eau d'Hiver"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1674728ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1674728" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/455961">Lom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-26">10/26/22 11:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is incredibly unexciting. I don't find that it has a character, a very familiar fragrant, could be a perfume from a nature shop. I thought it is too safe and did not catch my attention. Disappointing for a Diptique fan.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1674728"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1674728#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1665074" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I like rose scent but this one is kinda pricey.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1665074"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1665074#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1662117" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I have bodyshop's mist who really similar with this expensive bottle. Not a fan for this one, but orpheon and fleur de peau always in my heart</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1662117"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1662117#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1662008" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1662008" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cymbaline1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310954"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1310954.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cymbaline1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Fleur-de-Peau-Eau-de-Parfum-48681.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48681.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fleur de Peau Eau de Parfum"title="Fleur de Peau Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1662008ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1662008" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310954">Cymbaline1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-08">10/08/22 18:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wanted a more syrupy fruit note. It's a beautiful rose fragrance but not as sweet fruity I was hoping for.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1662008"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1662008#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1659122" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1659122" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mewyq"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1277030"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1277030.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mewyq" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14214.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Rose"title="Eau Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1659122ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1659122" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1277030">mewyq</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-04">10/04/22 18:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's easier to wax lyrical about a complex perfume than a simple one like Eau Rose. It is not intriguing, nor does it pretend to be. Eau Rose is, to me, the olfactory translation of Waterhouse's 'The Soul of the Rose'.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1659122"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1659122#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1656031" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1656031" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ceszsy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1476402"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1476402.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ceszsy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1656031ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1656031" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1476402">Ceszsy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-30">09/30/22 07:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am not a rose scent lover since it just smelled synthetic and too strong for my liking, and even Rose flowers I dislike. I tried Delina OG and the La Rosee one, which were both strong and too much for my nose to handle. I decluttered my Delina OG while I kept the La Rosee in hopes that I could learn to love her. Mustering up the courage, I tried Eau Rose EDT .<br />
<br />
Eau Rose was a blind buy that I was scared that I'll regret, but was happy that I loved it! Looking at the top notes which are Litchi, Blackcurrant, and Bergamont, when I sprayed it on my skin, the first note that I spotted was the Blackcurrant. Then after some time, I got whiffs of the litchi, but somehow I did not detect the citrus from the bergamont.<br />
<br />
If I were to compare this to another perfume, a close yet different fragrance that I adore as well, it would be Jo Malone Poppy and Barley. Since they both have Blackcurrant in their top notes.<br />
<br />
Yes, it is rosey, I do smell the roses here, but it is not the jammy sweet type of rose like Delina, or the soapy fresh vibes of Chloe, or a spicy type of rose like Byredo Rose of no Man's Land. It is a beautiful, delicate, demure type of rose that uplifts your spirit.<br />
<br />
Eau Rose is not overpowering, and is a crowd pleaser. I don't think anyone would hate this fragrance. But, if you were the type of person who wants a extraordinary and unique type of rose scent, I would not recommend this.<br />
<br />
Yes it is a beautiful fragrance, but as it dries down, it does not transform or change that much. The longevity on my skin is around 3-4 hours and projects quite well during the first hour. <br />
<br />
All in all, Eau Rose is definitely my top Rose Scent, with Rose Gourmand from Zara as second, and Deljna La Rosee as the third since those are my only rose focused scents.<br />
<br />
It is a perfect summer or spring fragrance, and even as a signature scent. This would suit all ages.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1656031"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1656031#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1643996" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1643996" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ifffy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1570174"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ifffy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Balenciaga/Florabotanica-15512.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15512.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Florabotanica"title="Florabotanica"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1643996ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1643996" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1570174">ifffy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-13">09/13/22 04:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was intrigued by its frequent appearance on instagram influencer's feeds and it looked pretty so I went to the store and took a sniff. It was super lovely! soapy rose vibes, which apart from green and fresh rose, is my favorite type of the flower. However, when I actually invested in a bottle (it is pricey) , I found myself disappointed because it was sweeter than I remembered. The soapiness is only there when directly sniffed at the nozzle. Also, I had bought (and passed on) a bottle of Paul Smith Rose for the very reason that it was sweeter than I preferred. This is like a higher end duplicate of the very same perfume, with almost nothing different. I regretted paying this much when Smith's was a much better value. But the bottle is pretty and I think the scent can still be elevated in a colder climate, when the litchi sweetness subdues. Even though its a rose scent, the honey, currant and the litchi are not shy to shine at all. To me this is also not as organic of a rose smell. For that, rose splendide/absolute ( I cant recall which) by goutal would be a better fit, and for a holistic rose, florabotanica is the ideal.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1643996"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1643996#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1637063" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1637063" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="perfumedpenguin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1195268"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="perfumedpenguin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1637063ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1637063" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1195268">perfumedpenguin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-03">09/03/22 02:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It smells literally like rose water and honey and performs very well, I sprayed hours ago and it still projects. I like it better in colder weather as the honey note feels a little off on very hot days though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1637063"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1637063#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1635222" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Lychee does add a lot of sweetness but you can mix this with any other rose to tone it down. I will add this to my closet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1618768"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1618768#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1616109" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1616109" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dashworth3156"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1546393"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="dashworth3156" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1616109ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1616109" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1546393">dashworth3156</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-03">08/03/22 08:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'd been waiting to try this one for a while, I find the juxtaposition of a Rose Fragrance on a man really interesting and I think it could work well on me, especially for Spring. But it needs to be the right Fragrance, and this unfortunately wasn't quite it. This smells very pleasant and authentic, but it smells a lot closer to Rose Essential Oil or Rose Soap on my skin and I wanted something ultra refreshing, juicy almost. It's also very feminine, I was obviously expecting it to be more feminine leaning but not this much. Honestly I'd like something quite similar to Delina by PDM but slightly less sweet and a little more refreshing, aquatic almost. Any suggestions will be very well-received, thank-you in advance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1616109"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1616109#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1595585" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; The lychee brightens the composition and evokes a dewy, pink rose. Alas, this has minimal lasting power. Such a shame as I am picky with rose dominant scents. <br />
<br />
I have a sample of the EDP and have been layering the two. The EDP is deeper and seems to have more lasting power, but dont think Ill pursue a FB as I am set with rose frags that are better value imo.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex;
