padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1593443" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="christinebyh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1525854"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1525854.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="christinebyh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1593443ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1593443" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1525854">christinebyh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-29">06/29/22 02:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It surprises me how well-loved this perfume is. To me, this is a very underwhelming one-dimensional rose perfume that smells nothing like the real flower or the many variations of the rose essence. This is the most simple light synthetically manufactured rose accord, combined with attractive sounding supporting notes that I can hardly detect. The geranium is there to make the one dimensional rose accord smell more full-bodied, but that alone isn't enough. I'm really disappointed with this fragrance - it really is just a watered-down synthetic rose (heavy on PEA), just like the name suggests.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1593443"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1593443#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1592210" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1592210" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="miss_chris"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1476523"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1476523.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="miss_chris" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1592210ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1592210" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1476523">miss_chris</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-27">06/27/22 06:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a fresh, authentic rose scent. It smells like young rose buds, stems and leaves all crushed together with a bit of lychee juice squeezed on top. It isnt heavy and would make a great summer scent. Doesnt last long on my skin - maybe 4 hours - but lasts longer if you also spray on your clothes.  If youre looking for a nice fresh rose that is modern and not old lady, eau rose is a good choice</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1592210"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1592210#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1588539" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1588539" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="venusbruises"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6054"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="venusbruises" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1588539ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1588539" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6054">venusbruises</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-21">06/21/22 06:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I generally want to smell like a walking rose bush and this does the trick. This has the exact smell of garden roses after a sprinkle of rain. It has the fresh, vegetal quality of rose leaves and stems in it, which I very much like. The honey in the base adds some sweetness into it, but fortunately for me the note is not very recognisable as honey per se. Eau Rose edt is one of my favourite fragrances, the only minus I would say is that it's not very long-lasting. For this price range the performance is quite poor, as it lasts only for 3-4 hours on my skin and completely vanishes in 6. Other than that this fragrance ticks all the boxes for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1588539"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1588539#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1583240" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1583240" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="carmenandmonkey"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1354276"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1354276.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="carmenandmonkey" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1583240ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1583240" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1354276">carmenandmonkey</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-12">06/12/22 18:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An uplifting modern sweet rose scent. It doesn't smell like actual fresh rose petals though (I thought it did when I smelled it in store, hence I sought out a decant). I'm spraying it on my pillow and towels, not so much on skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1583240"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1583240#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1555403" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1555403" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kmyechan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1464430"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1464430.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kmyechan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zara/Fields-at-Nightfall-64241.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64241.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fields at Nightfall"title="Fields at Nightfall"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1555403ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1555403" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1464430">kmyechan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-02">05/02/22 10:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Absolutely stunning.<br />
I get mostly rose and currant leaf, sustained by light woodsy notes and a hint of caramel (which is probably the honey) - sweet but not too sweet, floral but not intensely so, just lovely. The rose is green and fresh, not jammy at all. Very feminine and pretty. <br />
<br />
Longevity on skin is unfortunately poor but this lasts a solid 7 hours on fabric.<br />
Sillage is moderate. This would be a great everyday scent, appropriate for all occasions including the office.<br />
I have a travel spray and could see myself getting a full bottle when I'm through.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1555403"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1555403#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1546933" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1546933" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bumix"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1488545"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1488545.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bumix" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1546933ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1546933" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1488545">Bumix</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-19">04/19/22 23:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a proper rose perfume . It smell like the actual flower petals . Is feminine , light but without being too flowery/ gardeny. <br />
I love it so much that I wear it in solid and spray. <br />
It lasts for 4/5 hours , so has a good longevity for being a eau de toilette .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1546933"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1546933#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1546344" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1546344" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Minimijn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1298386"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1298386.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Minimijn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/The-Yulong-58907.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.58907.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Th Yulong"title="Th Yulong"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1546344ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1546344" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1298386">Minimijn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-19">04/19/22 05:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a sample of this, or I probably wouldnt have tried it. I dont consider myself a rose person; it gets overwhelming quick and I usually prefer white florals. When I sprayed this on, however, I quite liked it, but I didnt think it was particularly enchanting. I kept smelling my wrists throughout the day, though, and I couldnt stop myself. Something about this perfume is addicting, and I have no clue what it is. <br />
Its not cloying or sickly sweet, it has enough green notes. Its very dainty but not in a childish way. Id actually call this quite sophisticated, but its not mature. On me it lasts about 5 hours, which I find reasonable for an EDT, if on the short side. <br />
I ordered the solid perfume, and Im excited to see how that lasts!<br />
<br />
Edit: Solid perfume opens slightly more blackcurrant leaf than fruit, but dries down exactly the same as the liquid version. Lasts about the same as well, and is just as addictive. Its a surprisingly heavy case, lacquered and really pretty. Great for on the go!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1546344"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1546344#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1544835" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1544835" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aspirina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/128870"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.128870.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="aspirina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Eaudemoiselle-de-Givenchy-Ambre-Velours-18920.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18920.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eaudemoiselle de Givenchy Ambre Velours"title="Eaudemoiselle de Givenchy Ambre Velours"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1544835ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1544835" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/128870">aspirina</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-16">04/16/22 14:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Pretty fruity rose with a strong note of cedar. It has green nuances, like smelling the crushed leaves of the rose. In that aspect it reminds me of Sa Majeste la rose, another fragrance with green notes.<br />
Delicate and feminine, but not very original. I like it a lot, but not a full bottle need.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1544835"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1544835#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1544483" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1544483" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lola7"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1487795"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lola7" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1544483ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1544483" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1487795">Lola7</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-16">04/16/22 02:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was a gift and when I opened my present I was disappointed to see a rose scent.... I'm not a big fan. However, this fragrance is truly beautiful, the rose soft and delicate. The cedar, musk and bergamot save it from being an outrageously floral, cloying, sticky rose. It is young and modern, aided by the lychee which gives it a fresh, juicy quality. It's unlike any other rose scent I've tried (which tend to be too blousy for my taste). I wish it had longer staying power, but I almost feel that if it did, it would lose its beauty. It's an ideal fragrance if you don't want to offend anyone with a bold statement - easy to wear if you exist in small spaces. Up close it is warm and comforting, fresh, modern and very elegant.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1544483"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1544483#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1539584" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1532412" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="meredithxx"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1479505"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1479505.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="meredithxx" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ella-K-Parfums/Musc-K-84119.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84119.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Musc K"title="Musc K"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1532412ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1532412" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);
