It is a rose with a younger vibe to me. I could appreciate this scent on someone else. Im just not enough of a floral person that I would want to wear this, because I dont really notice much else to balance the flower smell out.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1532412"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1532412#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1527453" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1527453" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wenshere"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1409653"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1409653.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="wenshere" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Ginger-Biscuit-Cologne-2023-87708.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87708.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ginger Biscuit Cologne (2023)"title="Ginger Biscuit Cologne (2023)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1527453ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1527453" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1409653">wenshere</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-21">03/21/22 07:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells less sweet and less pronounced than I expected it to. It's quite simple, it's mostly just roses. I do get the litchi in the opening, it's bright and juicy and fresh (not strong like in Delina's though), which I loved! But sadly it quickly fades away. I wish it lasted longer because I really love how it is in the opening! The dry down is clean and slightly powdery to my nose, which is nice but nothing too exciting to me. It's just not quite what I had hoped for personally since I expected it to be sweeter because of the honey note, which I didn't really get at all.<br />
<br />
Like many others said though, this is a true rose scent and I agree, because it doesn't lean towards either sweet or green or sour or anything, overall it's a very 'neutral' kind of rose scent with light touches of fruitiness (although I wouldn't categorize it as a fruity floral). Even though it's not what I had hoped for I do think it's a nice scent. It's elegant, inoffensive and flexible. I think it's appropriate for most occasions and a great scent for layering.  <br />
<br />
Note: For those curious, compared to 'Red Roses' from Jo Malone for example, this one smells less in-your-face and less allergy-inducing vibe-wise. Red Roses to me smells like roses but in a hay-fever kind of way and I'm personally not a fan of that. The rose in this one is simple but elegant.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1527453"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1527453#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1510823" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1510823" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fragaddict123"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1289934"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1289934.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fragaddict123" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1510823ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1510823" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1289934">Fragaddict123</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-23">02/23/22 20:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of the better quality roses in the market <br />
BUT<br />
There is always a but<br />
Longevity.<br />
it was weak unfortunately and a weak fragrance is a waste of hard earned money <br />
Projection for the first hour or two is grand and thats it</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1510823"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1510823#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1507529" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1507529" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ythefnot"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1461907"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1461907.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ythefnot" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1507529ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1507529" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1461907">ythefnot</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-19">02/19/22 04:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>SO rose, if you love rose, I recommend, it is nice</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1507529"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1507529#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1502298" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1502298" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ouimet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1418815"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1418815.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ouimet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/The-Maker/Libertine-72536.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72536.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Libertine"title="Libertine"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1502298ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1502298" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1418815">ouimet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-11">02/11/22 07:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just like everyone has said in chorus this is a great true rose- it accomplishes exactly what it promises, which I can appreciate, but don't love for wearing myself alone. <br />
That said, I love this scent most when I'm layering to add complexity when I want a rose with a lil something extra. <br />
<br />
This + MM Bubble Bath is like the most luxurious spa you've ever been in. Clean, fresh, lovely- soapy without abrasiveness. Rose without powder, but to the same kind of effect. <br />
<br />
This + DedCool's Taunt is a warm, sweet amber rose that you would want to get from your lover on Valentine's Day. <br />
<br />
I don't know that I would ever commit to a full bottle, but it's a nice and inoffensive rose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1502298"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1502298#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1499396" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1499396" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jaclyncxh"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1314803"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1314803.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jaclyncxh" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Artemisia-4547.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4547.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Artemisia"title="Artemisia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1499396ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1499396" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1314803">jaclyncxh</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-07">02/07/22 08:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This used to strike me as overly simplistic and a bit boring but after a longer time with other perfumes and a bit of olfactory fatigue, this simplicity is a very welcomed relief. This rose is pure, watery, the scent of freshly steamed Damascus rose in the form of a clear drop of rose water. There is something, oh so elusive, that makes it juicer and a touch of green freshness, but nothing detracts from the main focus of pink, delicate rose petals. It is balanced and naturalistic with a touch of sweetness. <br />
<br />
Rose rose rose. There are so many contenders but nothing has stayed as true to its source material to me as Eau Rose.  I've had a go at Jo Malone's red roses and Lush's Rose Jam which present a heady, sweet and jammy cooked roses and sugar. They tend to be a bit too much for me. I've also had a go at MFK A la rose, which presents a very similar rose scent and freshness but has his signature Egyptian musk which is so distinct and strong in a way that transform the rose scent into something else altogether and is cloying and slightly vulgar to my nose. Luna from penhaligon's is juicy rosy but it's fruity lemon notes overpower the rose accord as well. Lombre dan L'eau is more about smelling the grassy fields and rose bushes and a thorny but refreshing sharpness more than rose itself. <br />
<br />
Eau Rose, is my personal winner. An all rounder, easy, everyday perfume. Uncomplicated, classic rose. At its price point it is also is the best deal in my opinion. There are other naturalistic realistic roses that are undoubtedly as good, such as Penhaligon's Elizabethan Rose and Duchess Rose, but they would cost at least twice or trice the price of Eau Rose. Verdict is if you love roses, get it, and even if you don't you might just fall in love with it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1499396"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1499396#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1492537" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1492537" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="correspondencepersonal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1060843"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1060843.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="correspondencepersonal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/My-Burberry-Black-32566.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32566.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="My Burberry Black"title="My Burberry Black"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1492537ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1492537" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1060843">correspondencepersonal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-27">01/27/22 21:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Finding that I really love Valentino's Donna Rosa Verde has opened up a search for other rose perfumes.<br />
I just spritzed this perfume on my arm and was amazed when I checked how this was working with my chemistry.<br />
<br />
This is a beautiful realistic type rose, the blend is slightly stronger than VDRV.  <br />
This is one to continue testing.  <br />
Test one went well; this is so surprising, I wouldn't have thought that I would have liked this type of rose perfume, but SURPRISE!  This is really GREAT ON!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1492537"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1492537#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1489686" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1489686" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lihsinhsu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1273388"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="lihsinhsu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1489686ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1489686" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1273388">lihsinhsu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-24">01/24/22 03:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Started out as as pink and powdery rose then gradually developed into realistic blossoming red rose with a hint of green. Definitely a universally pleasing feminine fragrance. I'd probably layer it with something else to give it a bit of oomph tho.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1489686"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1489686#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1480585" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1480585" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SSBurn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1298438"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1298438.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SSBurn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Angham-96768.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96768.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Angham"title="Angham"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1480585ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1480585" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1298438">SSBurn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-10">01/10/22 21:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A group member in a facebook fragrance group mentioned this to me while in my search for a jammy rose. Not that this is one but he mentioned it as a photorealistic rose and man oh man!!!! This smells literally like beautiful soft fresh roses. Nothing more and definitely nothing less. Im not a floral person but this is just so accurate and uncomplicated I had to have it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1480585"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1480585#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1478692" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1478692" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vrothermod"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1282790"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1282790.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="vrothermod" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1478692ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1478692" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1282790">vrothermod</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-08">01/08/22 00:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Now this is a TRUE rose. Not synthetic smelling at all. It's just so pleasant and beautiful. Literally smells like you're smelling a rose in a garden somewhere on a summer day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1478692"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1478692#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1478646" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1478646" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CascadiaCore"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1425993"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1425993.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CascadiaCore" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1478646ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1478646" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1425993">CascadiaCore</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-07">01/07/22 21:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is SO realistic- quite fresh and a very literal interpretation. Its more of a pink or yellow rose than that deeper, heavy, red rose scent. There is indeed a green note that really brings the realism to the next level. Never heavy or overwhelming. Feels like a silky, cool, early morning in the garden in July when things are really swinging into full bloom. It fills me with life! <br />
<br />
If your really looking for it you can pick out the geranium or the citrus, but any rose gardener knows that different rose varietals all have various notes that play off each-other quite similarly to this! Unless your nose is so powerful can tell a Julia Child Rose from a Queen Mary Rose, I would say smelling blindfolded youll find this indistinguishable from the real thing. <br />
<br />
This scent reminds me so much of my mom. While shes never worn perfume, shes a rose enthusiast and always has a lot of fresh tea roses in and around her house in the summer. If your a gardener or a garden lover this one will definitely resonate with you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1478646"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1478646#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1474988" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1474988" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="daffodilsandcoffee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1438987"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1438987.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="daffodilsandcoffee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Luna-38351.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38351.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Luna"title="Luna"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1474988ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1474988" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1438987">daffodilsandcoffee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-01-02">01/02/22 10:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm going through a rose phase and I love this. It's a fresh, dewy, realistic rose with some citrus and fruity notes.<br />
<br />
I tried the hair mist and fell in love. It's not huge on lasting power but I still catch whiffs of it hours later. <br />
<br />
I received a sample of the EDP version that's realeasing soon. They swapped the citrus and fruit for artichoke and chamomile. Interesting, and still very rosy, but I prefer the EDT.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1474988"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1474988#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1459316" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1459316" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Snt_Gulab"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1319079"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1319079.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Snt_Gulab" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nina-Ricci/L-Extase-Rose-Absolue-43084.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43084.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Extase Rose Absolue"title="L'Extase Rose Absolue"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1459316ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1459316" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1319079">Snt_Gulab</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-07">12/07/21 15:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Finally getting down to writing about this work of absolute art. Smelt it in store and compared to philosykos instant out. Tried Le Labo Rose 31, and it was so weak and pathetic that I got a sample of eau rose Diptyque. <br />
<br />
A little girl accidentally dropped it all over my carpet and sleeves and now, this beautiful angelic heavenly juice is all over my sweater. On this cold grey dark December day, the Sun going down at 4pm, this is a lukewarm sunset bubble bath with rose petals. <br />
<br />
Fresh. Clean. Realistic rose and other florals. But mostly a clean bloomed pink rose forward. Its not as in your face red bald rose like portrait of a lady. Its in the background. Universally loved. Everyone wants to dance with her. In this way, its generic, but like all of Diptyques, yes its one of their most marketable mainstream scents, but Jesus the layers. It has layers. Opens beautiful. Fresh. Fruity. Almost fizzy. Wet. Dries down to a musky floral slightly green rose. And then after a few hours soft woods come out as if the waves on the beach are having a lazy day and its just pulling up and leaving behind some white foam but imagine that with the smell of cedar. The musk stays throughout in the background. <br />
<br />
Stays 12+ hours on pulse points. Similar on clothes. Its a friendly non offensive scent. Unless I make an effort, Ill forget its there and just believe Im a pretty princess who naturally smells that great. Definitely perfect for the office while still retaining luxury and complexity over other florals that can be linear or too strong and offensive.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1459316"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1459316#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1455300" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1455300" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="shiningyuzu"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1321835"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1321835.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="shiningyuzu" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Philosophy/Pure-Grace-Nude-Rose-45902.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45902.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pure Grace Nude Rose"title="Pure Grace Nude Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1455300ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1455300" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1321835">shiningyuzu</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-30">11/30/21 21:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This isn't fruity at all! This isn't sweet either. I get hardly any lychee, no blackcurrant, and no honey. Eau Rose smells just as the name sounds, a pure rose. It's fresh, cozy, and romantic! Honestly, I don't get anything but rose, and although I don't like rose fragrances, I would love this as a room spray or a candle! I don't have much to say, except if you like rose fragrances, you don't have much else to consider if you want to buy this! <br />
<br />
Scent: 8/10<br />
<br />
Longevity: 7/10<br />
<br />
Sillage: 6/10<br />
<br />
Price: 5/10<br />
<br />
School and Work Friendly!<br />
<br />
Would recommend a blind buy<br />
<br />
Age: 15-40<br />
<br />
Yours Truly, <br />
Yuzu </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1455300"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1455300#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1451643" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1451643" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mangooo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1401700"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="mangooo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1451643ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1451643" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1401700">mangooo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-24">11/24/21 13:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is such a lovely slightly sweet rose scent. On initial spray it smelled lovely and you get a soft &amp; fresh rose scent but nothing really stood out to me. I felt like this was missing a bit of a punch. Once it fully dried down though, the litchi started to come out some more &amp; brings out some light sweetness to balance out the rose and I found myself really enjoying this. I really love the dry down on this one. It's well balanced and inoffensive. <br />
<br />
Sillage is okay and lasting isn't the best, but it does linger pretty well on clothes.<br />
<br />
EDIT: for those curious about the new EDP, I personally enjoy the EDT more. The EDP has an artichoke note and that's almost all I smell. It still has the DNA of the original though so it's a gorgeous rose. If you like more feminine with a hint of sweetness then go EDT. If you want something fresher and less feminine try the EDP.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1451643"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1451643#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1420587" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1420587" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kaylietam"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1396245"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="kaylietam" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1420587ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1420587" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1396245">kaylietam</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-01">10/01/21 21:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love rose fragrances in general but this was one of the few that I really disliked because of its overpowering green notes. To put it simply, this fragrance smells not only like a rose flower, but the entire rose plant, with its leaves, stem and even soil. I can imagine some people liking it, but it's not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1420587"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1420587#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1417584" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1417584" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sweetperfumeprincess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1213578"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1213578.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sweetperfumeprincess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1417584ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1417584" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1213578">sweetperfumeprincess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-26">09/26/21 18:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>No one is lying when they call this perfume a photorealistic rose!  <br />
<br />
There is nothing in the least bit synthetic or artificial about this perfume. It truly does smell like you are standing in a garden surrounded by roses thanks to the green aroma in the beginning, or perhaps taking tea with your wealthy step-mother on the lawn of some posh hotel. <br />
<br />
I have never smelt anything like it to be honest, and I have no idea how Diptyque made it. Eau Rose is super fresh but not in a citrus way like D&amp;G Light Blue. I don't enjoy citrus scents but I think bergamot might be the exception. However I do love a fresh perfume, so a fresh perfume that is not just a citrus bomb is perfect for me. The citrus here is the perfect companion to the rose, which is the real hero. (Naturally given the name.)  The black currant adds a delectable berry note, but I am obsessed with berry scents so of course I like this note despite it not being the star. Also this perfume is watery, but in a way that really truly works--like rose water, if you will. <br />
<br />
Eau Rose is refreshing, classy and super feminine. It's not sweet or warm or gourmandy, so if that is your jam maybe not the best blind buy. However this does enchant me, a girl who usually prefers sickeningly sweet headache inducing scents! <br />
<br />
Eau Rose by Diptyque is simply a refreshing sip of heaven in a bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1417584"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1417584#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1407369" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1407369" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vickalicious"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/59086"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.59086.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vickalicious" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bath-Body-Works/Iced-Lemon-Pound-Cake-81256.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81256.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Iced Lemon Pound Cake"title="Iced Lemon Pound Cake"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1407369ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1407369" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/59086">Vickalicious</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-09">09/09/21 14:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Overall I really like Diptyque as a house. Honestly, I dont think Ive come across a fragrance that theyve done that Ive disliked.<br />
<br />
This one is a pleasant fresh rose fragrance. A bit green in the beginning, then it smells very much like rosewater or like a pink rose that may be growing in a garden. It is slightly sweet because of the litchi, and I do detect a little bit of ambroxan but not a lot. This one is in the same vein as Delina (fragrance Im not a fan of), but I prefer this one a bit more. Also, I should note that the performance on this is not that great. I want to say it lasted maybe about two hours and then it changed into a cedar/ citrus/ambroxan in the third hour with very little rose. After that it was basically gone. Not bad, but this is a pass for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1407369"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1407369#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1395966" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1395966" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Harold-Meissner"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1198935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Harold-Meissner" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Mimosa-Cardamom-31825.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31825.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mimosa & Cardamom"title="Mimosa & Cardamom"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1395966ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1395966" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1198935">Harold-Meissner</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-20">08/20/21 15:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>THE MOST REALISTIC ROSE!!! This is light as fresh like one of those refreshing rose water facial mists. I find rose to be very calming. All that being said it does leave a sour taste after a while. Similar to acetone. Upon smelling the roses in my yard, I cant tell a difference. I just wish this to smell more sugary and lasts more than 2 1/2 hours</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1395966"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1395966#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1388998" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1388998" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="clairesque"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1347367"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1347367.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="clairesque" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clean/Skin-35244.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35244.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Skin"title="Skin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1388998ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1388998" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1347367">clairesque</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-08">08/08/21 18:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As much as I like this scent, I find it pretty weak and lackluster, especially considering the price. It's a light, fresh, watery rose with some faint green aromatics and a hint of fruitiness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1388998"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1388998#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1372760" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1372760"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1372760#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1364549" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1364549" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="venussansfurs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1334239"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1334239.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="venussansfurs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Jules-1243.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1243.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jules"title="Jules"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1364549ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1364549" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1334239">venussansfurs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-23">06/23/21 06:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'd call it Eau Roseberry because it's more fruity than rosy.  It's fresh rather than sweet for the first few hours, which I like, but the laundry-style musky dry down is much like Fleur de Peau's, which I'm not particularly fond of.  So it's a like for the first half and a dislike for the second half, which makes it an ok overall.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1364549"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1364549#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1352651" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1352651" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bergamotted"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1328799"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1328799.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bergamotted" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1352651ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1352651" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1328799">bergamotted</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-01">06/01/21 10:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance never fails to put a smile on my face. Although linear, it's a happy and fresh rose-lychee concoction. The rose is young and pink. I would wear this any time but it definitely works the most magic during spring.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1352651"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1352651#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1328242" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1328242" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dsty"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/781639"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.781639.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dsty" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pierre-Guillaume-Paris/Praline-de-Santal-12143.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12143.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Praline de Santal"title="Praline de Santal"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1328242ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1328242" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/781639">dsty</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-19">04/19/21 09:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It took me a long time to get my hands on a decant of Eau Rose, which is puzzling in hindsight: it made me think that it was either discontinued, which doesn't seem to be the case, or not very popular, which seems very hard to believe now that I have tested it. It's exactly what you'd expect from a rose scent by Diptyque: simple, transparent, light and airy, rather natural - but for all that with a distinct personality and a charm all of its own. A sure-footed kind of scent! <br />
<br />
It's "just right" in every way, very easy to wear without every getting boring. The rose is a little botanical-leaning but not at all sharp, and the other notes aren't distinguishable in their own right, but they serve to enhance that just-a-little-better-than-realistic effect, lending a very subtle, lighthearted sweetness to the composition. There are lots of scents with the same concept of fruity notes lightening up a realistic rose, and I love them all if they're done well, but this must be the most elegant version of that idea I've come across, there's really nothing girly about it, however light and happy it smells. <br />
<br />
I could easily imagine it as a signature scent (if only I didn't feel that same way about around a hundred other scents as well); it's the kind of timeless, ageless, any-weather, any-occasion fragrance that's hard to tire of. The only downside, as always with Diptyque, is that the longevity is disappointing (but then again, it's hard to imagine a long-lasting scent this airy)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1328242"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1328242#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1318807" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1318807" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="huet82"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246883"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="huet82" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Parfum-49104.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49104.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tam Dao Eau de Parfum"title="Tam Dao Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1318807ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1318807" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246883">huet82</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-03">04/03/21 10:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bought a sample from Luckyscents. Light, fun, and playful. Strong citrus and light green to start that develops into a sweet, powdery musk (definitely cashmeran to my nose, but with an added hint of something else). Gives me slight air freshener vibes, but it's pleasant. :)<br />
<br />
Can't really comment on sillage because the sample isn't in a spray bottle, but if I had to guess, would probably sit close to skin fairly quick based on how light it is inherently.<br />
<br />
Edit: Ended up buying a bottle!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1318807"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1318807#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1310464" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1310464" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pacifica_"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1311436"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1311436.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pacifica_" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1310464ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1310464" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1311436">Pacifica_</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-19">03/19/21 10:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a lovely, simple rose. Just smells like rose water to me, a with a little tartness. I get very little to no black currant or lychee besides the tartness. Not FBW but very enjoyable. A safe blind buy if you like rose scents. Would be easy to layer other scents with this. Will update on longevity (I dont expect much given its an EDT tbh.) Sillage is meh, about 2 ft &amp; I unintentionally doused myself in it. I would definitely buy this as a candle though.<br />
<br />
Update on longevity: about 2 hours. I can barely smell it anymore. :/ only a faint vanilla note remains.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1310464"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1310464#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1296236" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1296236" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GlacialImpala"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1239305"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1239305.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="GlacialImpala" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1296236ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1296236" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1239305">GlacialImpala</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-21">02/21/21 02:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Plus: It's very light, the rose does smell natural but not as real as sniffing a real rose (I'm yet to find such perfume), the sweetness isn't overpowering the rose, but jasmine might.<br />
Minus: it's very gentle, and yet you probably won't want to experience this scent in higher concentration because it's just not interesting at all. You will appreciate it if you were 'hurt' but rosey florals before and will thank it for staying so well mannered but FBB... only if your daily activities demand your perfume stays unnoticable and you like sweet roses.<br />
<br />
Oh another plus, it doesn't smell like Nair, I mean L'Ombre Dans L'Eau.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1296236"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1296236#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1293662" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1303629">Voyagevoyage33</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-16">02/16/21 11:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's supremely rosy..!  May seem linear or preppy but it's actually rather impish. It's uplifting but you kinda need to be in the mood to be uplifted...if that makes sense :) a green rose, mild projection (unless generously spritzed). I find it perfect for daytime. Didn't get a chance to try it yet in warm weather. I'd say it's a safe blind buy if you catch a sale or you like fresh smelling perfumes and of course, ROSES!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1293662"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1293662#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1292938" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
