(-)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1292938"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1292938#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1289589" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1289589" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LandNoise"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1225779"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1225779.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LandNoise" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Un-Jardin-a-Cythere-79225.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.79225.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Un Jardin  Cythre"title="Un Jardin  Cythre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1289589ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1289589" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1225779">LandNoise</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-09">02/09/21 04:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A "juicy" rose, on account of the lychee accord.  Smooth and fresh -- I'm a rose-loving man, and I wear this from time to time.  Nice hand cream in this line, too.  Diptyque's bath/body lines are second to none.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1289589"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1289589#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1288252" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1288252" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mikecch"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/380403"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.380403.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mikecch" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1288252ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1288252" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/380403">mikecch</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-06">02/06/21 16:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To my nose this is a very clever and modern rose soliflore.<br />
<br />
Opens with a herbaceous and fruity rose. Not overly sweet, no powder at all. Elegant in its simplicity, the aromatic facets of the rose accord being extended. <br />
<br />
A clean, woody and slightly sweet background begins to form, as the greenery from the opening fades. The rose cleverly evolves, and at no point does it become excessively sweet or powdery.<br />
<br />
Eau Rose will smell striking on a lady, but I also didn't mind wearing it on my skin. The rose here, to me, as a fan of masculine rose accords, is not absolutely feminine. <br />
<br />
Highly recommended for at least a sampling for Rose fans.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1288252"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1288252#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1284417" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1284417" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Linda 1991."/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1301707"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Linda 1991." style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1284417ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1284417" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1301707">Linda 1991.</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-30">01/30/21 14:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my current signature scent, I absolutely adore it.<br />
This was a blind buy for me and I was pleasantly surprised honestly. Unlike most fragrances you will not get the synthetic smell. This is fresh making it perfect for a summers day, the balance between gourmand and rose is beautiful. This is a safe blind buy if you're a feminine lady that loves roses.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1284417"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1284417#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1282762" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1282762" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="taylorrose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1295107"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1295107.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="taylorrose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Solinotes/Yuzu-50453.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50453.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Yuzu"title="Yuzu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1282762ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1282762" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1295107">taylorrose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-27">01/27/21 13:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>at first smells just like Chloe Roses!<br />
<br />
a few minutes later sweet honey is more prominent....<br />
warm type of perfume (in my opinion)<br />
it is very mild perfume, i dont think theres any sillage.<br />
it is quite pleasant so far although Id prefer fleur de peau instead.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1282762"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1282762#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1277173" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1277173" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mirrorghost"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/292309"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.292309.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mirrorghost" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/L-Eau-d-Hiver-2797.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2797.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Eau d'Hiver"title="L'Eau d'Hiver"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1277173ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1277173" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/292309">mirrorghost</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-16">01/16/21 17:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>there are a lot of disliked notes in this for me, but i got a free sample so i'm testing it. i get a fruity rose to start- a lot of litchi which is not my cup of tea. i get a hint of greenery too...maybe from the rose or black currant, not sure. this is one of those roses with a modern musk in the background that gets a bit screechy on my skin, and the geranium gets kind of sour. this is one of those 'ladylike' pink rose perfumes. this isn't really 'me' i like dark red roses...spicy, incensy or musky. this one is just too bright and it goes both too sweet and too sour on my skin. i think a lot of people would enjoy this, it's just not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1277173"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1277173#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1272009" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1272009" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bubbles1964"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1095199"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1095199.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bubbles1964" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bastide-Aix-en-Provence/Lavande-in-Love-62387.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62387.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lavande in Love"title="Lavande in Love"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1272009ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1272009" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1095199">Bubbles1964</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-07">01/07/21 10:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a fresh rose and lush fruit composition; linear and simple with musk peeping out behind the curtain. I can imagine several occasions where this would work perfectly, especially suited for warm weather. Its light and easy, and projects with a natural disposition. <br />
<br />
Sometimes you need scents in your closet that are non-challenging, making Eau Rose a good perfume choice for the day after a failed U.S. government coup attempt.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1272009"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1272009#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1265702" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1265702" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dvorask"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1195070"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dvorask" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Prada/Prada-L-Homme-L-Eau-46400.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46400.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Prada L'Homme L'Eau"title="Prada L'Homme L'Eau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1265702ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1265702" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1195070">Dvorask</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-26">12/26/20 02:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Diptyque Eau Rose is a fresh rose with some muskiness added. Imagine what a rose smells like, and this is likely to come close to what you expect:<br />
- Not very green and sour, like L'ombre Dans L'eau <br />
- Not very soapy, like Amouage Lyric Man<br />
- Not earthy, like Tom Ford Noir de Noir<br />
<br />
It has some green facets that support, but never dominate the composition. There is a mild tartness from the fruits, although I can't tell you from which fruit it is coming from. In the drydown, there is musk.<br />
<br />
Despite rose being a stereotypically feminine note, a man can also wear this, if only in certain situations and after some thought into the outfit. I'm surprised nobody else holds the same opinion. <br />
<br />
If you're a male looking for a safe masculine rose, this isn't it. However, this is likely the closest you might be getting to something a male can pull off while being a rose soliflore. <br />
<br />
If you've smelled Jo Malone Red Roses or Perfumer's Workshop Tea Rose, those are very opulent and perfumey roses. Eau Rose is clearly rosy like them, but without the "THIS IS A ROSE!!!" attitude. Don't be put off by the note breakdown: I honestly don't get much of the litchi, black currant, and (thankfully) honey.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1265702"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1265702#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1261699" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1261699" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gia1913"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1273063"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gia1913" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Tam-Dao-Eau-de-Toilette-3956.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3956.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tam Dao Eau de Toilette"title="Tam Dao Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1261699ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1261699" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1273063">Gia1913</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-16">12/16/20 06:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Litchi and Rose, super simple and pretty. There is nothing offensive about this perfume and is best suited for hot summer days. I don't think anyone could strongly dislike it at all, men and women. <br />
<br />
Diptyque is known for their candles...and after reading about that, it does make me think that this perfume could very well be a super expensive candle scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1261699"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1261699#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1261498" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1261498" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cocofluff"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1141155"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1141155.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cocofluff" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/Bendelirious-4511.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4511.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bendelirious"title="Bendelirious"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1261498ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1261498" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1141155">cocofluff</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-15">12/15/20 17:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Eau Rose smells like rose scented magazine pages. I actually kinda love that. Reminds me of Prada Infusion Rose. -</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1261498"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1261498#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1253181" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1253181" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ViouAmara"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193580"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1193580.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ViouAmara" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Miraculum/Pani-Walewska-Noir-28606.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28606.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pani Walewska Noir"title="Pani Walewska Noir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1253181ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1253181" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193580">ViouAmara</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-11-25">11/25/20 23:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Rose, from top to toes. Nothing to disturb you from the fresh dewy rose bush, absolutely  perfect.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1253181"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1253181#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1239249" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1239249" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mauvealert"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259193"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1259193.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mauvealert" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Poppy-Barley-56152.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56152.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Poppy & Barley"title="Poppy & Barley"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1239249ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1239249" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259193">mauvealert</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-10-20">10/20/20 22:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A playful, natural, sweet and musky rose, seems to suit many moods and seasons. I don't perceive the linearity that some people do, I find it starts quite fruity, tart and green, very bergamot-y, but with a distinct dew-covered garden rose which floats the scent gently, through a patch of surprisingly pleasant geranium, into a gorgeous musky honey in the drydown. A few hours in it smells almost more gourmand than floral thanks to the honey note, but it is never offensively sweet. One of those that you could probably wear to the office, church, school pickup, date night, whatever.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1239249"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1239249#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1235810" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1235810" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hamano_Chiaki"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/46491"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.46491.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hamano_Chiaki" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Cinema-92.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.92.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cinma"title="Cinma"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1235810ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1235810" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/46491">Hamano_Chiaki</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-10-12">10/12/20 07:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Many people call this a little boring, and I can see why. However to me this is a unique rose scent, because it has nothing in it that bothers me, unlike most rose based fragrances. For example Paul Smith's Rose I ended up hating, but I still see the resemblance between these two. This one I ended up loving - it's very pretty and inoffensive but still smells like a real rose. Performance is pretty weak though, but I don't mind reapplying fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1235810"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1235810#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1231970" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1231970" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="evocative"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/566115"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="evocative" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Cristalle-Eau-Verte-5909.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5909.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cristalle Eau Verte"title="Cristalle Eau Verte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1231970ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1231970" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/566115">evocative</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-10-03">10/03/20 00:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Im in the same boat as Abigailrose99. Longevity and silage are appallingly low on me, too. I spray it on, its gorgeous, then its gone. It even disappears from my hair and clothes. Very disappointing for an almost $200 bottle of juice. I wont bother buying it again and its turned me off purchasing anything else from Diptyque, too. <br />
I noted another reviewer said this juice goes bad fast. I doubt that will be an issue for me as I predict Ill get through it so fast because it has no staying power at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1231970"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1231970#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1226543" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; The downside on this perfume is theyre expensive.. Other than that, I really2 love this fragrance!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1225787"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1225787#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1222849" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Crisp, watery, fresh pink rose that does not have an underlying synthetic smell but there is a soapy undercurrent. Its nice, albeit a bit boring. But if you love the smell of rose hydrosol and want something longer lasting, this is it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1212428"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1212428#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1185620" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1185620" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="abigailrose99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1241880"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="abigailrose99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1185620ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1185620" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1241880">abigailrose99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-06-08">06/08/20 06:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm pretty disappointed but i will be buying the limited edition because i am a bit of a brand w hore and love rose everything and the painted glass bottle is too pretty for me to pass up.<br />
<br />
let me start off by saying if you have tried this perfume and love the scent but think the sillage and longlevity is terrible, please do yourself a favor and try the "amazing grace" rose series! they aren't perfectly spot on for this but ballet rose is very similar has decent staying power for price IHMO. nude rose is like this but i bit less juicy and sweet, a bit more mature rose. sorry for my limited perfume vocab!<br />
<br />
scent is nice, refreshing and uplifting rose. so watery and weak even from the first spray that it doesn't appear as anything super unique. longevity is just horrible, like 5 minutes. on me at times :( i have only sampled but after i get my full bottle i will edit my review if this is not still true.<br />
<br />
after reading the review i left, i realize im such a sucker for spending money on the LI bottle from Nordstrom... but i really just want the box/bottle in my collection :|</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1166064" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="EnergeticCrab"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/536683"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.536683.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="EnergeticCrab" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1166064ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1166064" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); It's like a younger "Portrait of a Lady". Fresh and clear rose with well balanced supporting notes. It's a fantastic everyday scent with a modern sensibility. Very impressive!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1166064"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1166064#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1144309" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1144309" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="humaira_"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1225741"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="humaira_" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chanel-No-5-L-Eau-38543.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38543.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chanel No 5 L'Eau"title="Chanel No 5 L'Eau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1144309ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1144309" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1225741">humaira_</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-02-11">02/11/20 23:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>it just rose water, nothing more! and this is have really weak performance. i just can smell the scent for about 5-10 minutes, even if i smiff my skin i don't get the trace at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1144309"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1144309#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1139878" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1139878" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fyetan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/372423"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.372423.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fyetan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ralph-Lauren/Romance-825.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.825.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Romance"title="Romance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1139878ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1139878" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/372423">fyetan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-01-30">01/30/20 15:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you didn't tell me it was Diptyque I wouldn't have known. It's mostly a fresh-ish rose with a hint of fruit. I wanted a lychee heavy perfume and this wasn't it - in fact, I couldn't differentiate lychee from general "fruitiness".<br />
Sillage is low and longevity is about 4 hours.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1139878"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1139878#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1132759" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1132759" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Unfurling Blossoms"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1220411"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1220411.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Unfurling Blossoms" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-de-Lierre-Eau-de-Toilette-6500.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6500.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau de Lierre Eau de Toilette"title="Eau de Lierre Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1132759ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1132759" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1220411">Unfurling Blossoms</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-01-09">01/09/20 17:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A BEAUTIFUL photorealistic delicate yet spritely rose - less spritely than In Full Bloom by Kate Spade and more bright than Roses de Chloe by Chloe.<br />
<br />
My favorite rose scent so far!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1132759"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1132759#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1109315" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1109315" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="i2uby"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1207384"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1207384.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="i2uby" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Indult/Tihota-4346.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4346.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tihota"title="Tihota"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1109315ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1109315" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1207384">i2uby</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-10-24">10/24/19 08:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the most beautiful smelling rose I have ever come across. A true modern day rose. I find myself reaching for this one whenever I wear white, lace or pink accents. It's both romantic and refreshing. It's a great pick me up when you're feeling fatigued. It beats Jo Malone's Red Roses (even though it's the most realistic bouquet of roses), Byredo Rose of No Man's Land (too synthetic), and all variations of Chloe (headache inducing). Good for dates and is work appropriate. Finally found a rose scent I love and this is THE ONE. I have EVERYTHING in this scent: candle, hair mist, solid perfume and travel spray. Waiting for the 50 ml to come back in stock to buy it, since I heard how fast this fragrance expires. This is my second favorite fragrance from Diptyque and that says a lot about this brand I love so so so much.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1109315"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1109315#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1108648" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1108648" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="h149"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1210940"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1210940.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="h149" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1108648ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1108648" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1210940">h149</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-10-22">10/22/19 05:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is essentially a super fruity rose that turns into a nice laundry detergent on the dry-down. However! The deeper you huff the fragrance, the more the layers reveal themselves. The cedar, especially, is charming. It makes me think of going to the hot springs resort, soaping myself liberally with the spa soap before I have a good long soak, and then sitting in the sauna. It smells like I've spent a good three hours in there and have emerged feeling extremely clean and ready for bed. So while it's not a fragrance I would wear, it's an enjoyable experience.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1108648"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1108648#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1059273" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1059273" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LaLuNaveed"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1188088"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1188088.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LaLuNaveed" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Via-Cavour-I-47871.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47871.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Via Cavour I"title="Via Cavour I"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1059273ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1059273" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1188088">LaLuNaveed</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-11">05/11/19 07:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a sample of this fragrance and it is, oh! so beautiful. If you are a rose or peony lover give it a try. It's perfect for spring and summer as everyday fragrance. Gathers compliments. I sprayed it on my wrists before bed and the scent was still there in the morning. It opens with fresh, airy rose and the dry down is more powdery, beautiful from the first second to the last minute. Next on my list to buy a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1059273"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1059273#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1056451" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1056451" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ShannonIk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1184854"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1184854.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ShannonIk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1056451ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1056451" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1184854">ShannonIk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-02">05/02/19 12:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this perfume. And, I loved it from the initial spray to the dry down. I love it from beginning to end. It is simple, elegant and beautiful. The powdery notes in the dry down read like dark cocoa, to me. It is almost edible. (I'm dreaming of a confection comprised of dark chocolate and rose. Stay tuned, I may get tinkering in the kitchen.) And, I'm not at all mad at that because it is a beautiful rose/cocoa scent that make me think of decadence and romance. This may not be for everyone, but it is for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1056451"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1056451#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1043783" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1026544" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lmwimsatt"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1049092"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1049092.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lmwimsatt" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Love-in-White-4262.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4262.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Love in White"title="Love in White"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1026544ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1026544" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1023245" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="osaycj"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1172484"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1172484.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="osaycj" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1023245ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1023245" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); But the quality does not persist toward drying down. Kind of getting dull after 30 min.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1023245"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1023245#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1020442" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/870923">Brisa_Marina</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-01-14">01/14/19 08:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful sweet roses, touch of fruity in this. Its so clean and not at all artificial smelling. Nothing here is like the dry cracked potpourri, everything is fresh and green. For the price I would hope for longer wear but that is not the case for me. Even on clothing this evaporates into nothing after about 20 minutes. A shame, it is GORGEOUS but not worth the price or amount of times you have to reapply.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1020442"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1020442#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1001420" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Scent &amp; Quality: 9/10<br />
Longevity: 8/10<br />

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc964441" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bellahucollins"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1154602"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="bellahucollins" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma964441ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd964441" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1154602">bellahucollins</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-07-22">07/22/18 19:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>After going through several rose scents in hunt for the perfect one, I have definitely found it with Diptyque. I have previously owned Chloe &amp; Rose of No Mans Land Byredo but both were just too strong for me. This scent is fresh, happy and very feminine. It really reminds me of Spring/Summer. It doesn't wear as long on my skin as I would like it to, but the scent is worth it. It almost has a rooty scent to it, like that smell you get on your hands after gardening. It is very subtle and sweet but not overwhelmingly so- the perfect rose scent. I love this scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="964441"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=964441#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="14214" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>

My thoughts as follows: Feminine and pretty packaging.....Open it up to reveal a simple bottle inside....,fluid has a slight yellow tinge....Take off the cap for a quick 'no spray' sniff.....Hippocampal activation - Chloe by Chloe's powdery clean laundryness goin on here.....Initial spray: fresh, rosey and understated - way more interesting than Chloe.....Time lapse..... resisting the urge to re-spray, as the dry down has left me with sweet musk which i love so much. Lasts just as long as many edp's i own. Very pretty! Very nice!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="223289"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=223289#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1109315" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1109315" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="i2uby"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1207384"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1207384.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="i2uby" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Indult/Tihota-4346.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4346.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tihota"title="Tihota"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1109315ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1109315" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1207384">i2uby</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-10-24">10/24/19 08:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the most beautiful smelling rose I have ever come across. A true modern day rose. I find myself reaching for this one whenever I wear white, lace or pink accents. It's both romantic and refreshing. It's a great pick me up when you're feeling fatigued. It beats Jo Malone's Red Roses (even though it's the most realistic bouquet of roses), Byredo Rose of No Man's Land (too synthetic), and all variations of Chloe (headache inducing). Good for dates and is work appropriate. Finally found a rose scent I love and this is THE ONE. I have EVERYTHING in this scent: candle, hair mist, solid perfume and travel spray. Waiting for the 50 ml to come back in stock to buy it, since I heard how fast this fragrance expires. This is my second favorite fragrance from Diptyque and that says a lot about this brand I love so so so much.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1109315"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1109315#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1272009" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1095199">Bubbles1964</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-01-07">01/07/21 10:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a fresh rose and lush fruit composition; linear and simple with musk peeping out behind the curtain. I can imagine several occasions where this would work perfectly, especially suited for warm weather. Its light and easy, and projects with a natural disposition. <br />
<br />
Sometimes you need scents in your closet that are non-challenging, making Eau Rose a good perfume choice for the day after a failed U.S. government coup attempt.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex;
