padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc369971" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RosaMilena"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/53049"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.53049.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="RosaMilena" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Carolina-Herrera/Burning-Rose-31053.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31053.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Burning Rose"title="Burning Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma369971ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd369971" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/53049">RosaMilena</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-05-24">05/24/13 08:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>EAU ROSE by Diptyque<br />
<br />
Breathtakingly beautiful Rose.  Opens with a rush of bittersweet bergamot and juicy tart vine-ripe black currants followed immediately with a saturating flood of soft, tropical, delicately sweet litchi fruit.  A pristinely fresh and glorious rose makes her entrance amongst the sparkling lemony threads of dewy-green geranium, which provides a zesty citric strength and additional support to the principal rose scent itself.<br />
<br />
A subdued non-indolic jasmine woven throughout provides an extra touch of sweetly refined floral complexity without intruding on the precedence of the roses. A warm, clean cedar houses the entire creation beautifully, while a cozy white musk adds a delicate hint of tender sensuality. A fascinatingly delectable drop of honey infuses just a trace of voluptuously natural silken sweetness with complexity and depth.<br />
<br />
The Rose here is poised gracefully between the refreshing cool vivid clarity of the Black Currant/Geranium, and the sumptuously smooth warm sweetness of the Litchi/Jasmine. The perfect balance achieved here between the pull of these four exceptionally contrasting elements, both of which are supportive of the Rose, yet diametrically opposed to each other, is what makes this composition a unique masterpiece. It is both simple and extremely refined.  The myriad of subtle, elegant nuances woven within and throughout the strands of this scent tapestry succeed brilliantly. <br />
<br />
This is exquisitely beautiful. Perhaps the most beautiful rose I have ever smelled on my skin.  Sublime beauty personified in scent.  I love this one completely and utterly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="369971"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=369971#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1735056" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1735056" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="WhiteFlowerPrincess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1662712.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="WhiteFlowerPrincess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Lucky-48385.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48385.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lucky"title="Lucky"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1735056ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1735056" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712">WhiteFlowerPrincess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-15">01/15/23 19:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I first tried this in Mecca about a week ago after sampling  La Rose by Maison Francis Kurkdijan for the uptempth time and still not being sure about it ( La Rose, that is.)<br />
<br />
I told the girls in Mecca that I was desperate to find a realistic smelling rose that was a sweet pink rose with no citrus and little to no woodiness in the base, since I hate anything that is strong or smells remotely masculine.<br />
<br />
Well, they were right... this smells just like pure rosewater distilled from the rose! It delighted me so much, since the queen of flowers reigns supreme in this perfume and none of the other notes take over. All I can smell other than that is a tiny bit of litchi at the top to make it smell not as simple and a bit more sweet, but that's it. I also smell a tiny bit of the musk here, but I don't mind musk at all.<br />
<br />
If you want a lovely and feminine smelling rose that smells like the floral and not disgusting potpourri, citrus or some woody masculine scent that would smell better on your boyfriend or husband, buy this! My search for the perfect rose scent is finally complete :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="1735056"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=1735056#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="14214" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc424174" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PricklyAndHot"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/9852"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.9852.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PricklyAndHot" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Victoria-s-Secret/Basic-Instinct-3275.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3275.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Basic Instinct"title="Basic Instinct"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma424174ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd424174" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); Not more. Not less.<br />
<br />
Too simple for its price, but natural enough.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="424174"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=424174#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent535912" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc535912" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AveParfum"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.35807.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AveParfum" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Alba-6967.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6967.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alba"title="Alba"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma535912ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd535912" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807">AveParfum</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-10-28">10/28/14 12:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Another Diptyque that fails to impress.  What I get here is a pink rose soap with greenish fruit.  Smells a lot like shampoo or even hairspray.  I love going to the rose gardens on weekends, and I sniff hundreds of roses.  This does not smell like any natural rose I have ever smelled.  For a beautiful, more natural rose, I much prefer the drydown of Ombre Dans l'Eau.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="535912"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=535912#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent550281" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc550281" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sleepy*weasel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/849649"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.849649.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sleepy*weasel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Eau-de-Givenchy-1966.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1966.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau de Givenchy"title="Eau de Givenchy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma550281ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd550281" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/849649">sleepy*weasel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-12-18">12/18/14 04:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Average rose scent, much like many soaps, shampoos etc of decent quality. It has a nice green bed to it, but it unfortunately doesn't last very long. Well, it is an "Eau" after all. It's pleasant, undemanding, and unremarkable.  It's hardly La Fille de Berlin - there is very little base to complement the rose, and the actual rose itself is not very realistic, I think they could have done better.  It's reasonable quality and inoffensive, but I imagine this more as a room spray or pillow spray in a well-appointed B &amp; B, than a serious fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="550281"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=550281#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent380723" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc380723" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nijntjes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/539837"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.539837.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nijntjes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma380723ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd380723" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/539837">nijntjes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-06-26">06/26/13 05:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'ts nice! Let's start off with that ;). The rose note is the most apparent one from the beginning till now (wearing it for a couple of hours). (But that should be a good thing, considering the name!) I do must say rose isn't really my thing. I've tried a couple of rose scents and I like the smell of it, but they just don't really fit me. Thought they maybe would, because Miss Dior (new) is my signature, and this fragrance also contains some rose notes. <br />
Overall: nice fragrance, not overpowering, bit powdery, but not too much (I can't bear TOO powdery scents like Chloe or Iris Rose from E. Coudray). So if you're into rose, this is a very nice one!!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="14214"comment_id="380723"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Rose-14214.html?ccid=380723#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1144309" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;         <div class="strike-title"><span>Perfume Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="latest-list flex-container">
        <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/m.99254.jpg" style="width: 60px; height: 64px; margin-right: 0.5em; flex-shrink: 0"/>
        <a href="/perfume/Kayali-Fragrances/Yum-Boujee-Marshmallow-81-99254.html#cc2371735"><span class="link-span"></span>
            <span class="brand">Kayali Fragrances</span><br>            <span class="ztworowseclipse">Yum Boujee Marshmallow | 81</span>
        </a>
        <span class="avatar-tip" data-tooltip aria-haspopup="true" data-show-on="medium" data-disable-hover="false"
              tabindex="1" title="-marshmallow dream. I love it! Already my Kayali fav!!">by
            <em>niaandbeauty</em> <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/s.2122215.jpg"

    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>
